review: Very challenging puzzle-like train game. I cant say a single negative thing here, all fits, all works, All is though-out well. Add a nice ideas like trains bringing parts for building Yamato ship or a rocket, or Japanese Shinkanzen trains bringing material to build the Olympics. Pretty excellent design and flawless execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002019002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1708254167}
review:
You will end up bankrupt or with colliding trains.
From the second campaign page on you have literally no chance to win the game - or you are extremely lucky.
Trains start by themselves after a while and there is nothing you can do about it.
New train stations appear much too fast and the income is too low to build up a working rail system fast enough.
Nice little game with an absolute horrible gameplay mechanic.
Save your money - don't buy !

author: {'steamid': '76561198004009140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1704919971}
review: This game is really a lot of fun. I originally thought it was going to be like a train sim game but then discovered it was more like a puzzle/strategy game. Its all about time management, strategically laying rails, and planning out what trains can go when to avoid collisions. There's other things you have to manage as well such as not overbuilding and going bankrupt or making sure the switches on the tracks are switched to make sure the train goes to the correct station. Its one of those games that I start playing and next thing I know its like 2 hours later and I can't stop! There is a sandbox mode but I haven't tried that out as I'm still working my way through the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966331203', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1703889432}
review:
Recommended.

10/10  for the genre.   Your engineering skills will be put to the test!

Loved the game.  Completed the entire game with 3 stars on every map.   Basically, you have to plan your railroad tracks so that you can get trains from point A to point B.   There will be up to 8 different stations per map, that you will need to send trains to.  You will manage the train schedules and it can get hectic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032535719', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1710804937}
review: Die Regeln des Spieles sind recht einfach, jedoch ist das Erreichen der Ziele auf manchen Karten recht kniffelig. Die Karten bestehen z.T. auch aus zufÃ¤lligen Elementen, die durchaus EinfluÃŸ auf das Erreichen eines Zieles haben kÃ¶nnen. Wenn ein Zug unterwegs ist, kann man ihn in der Form beeinflussen, daÃŸ man die Weichen in seinem Weg stellt, den Zug anhÃ¤lt und wieder startet, und ihn auch umdrehen kann. Jeder Zug startet beim Spawnen mit einem Warenwert, der mit der Zeit stetig abnimmt, egal ob er gestartet ist, fÃ¤hrt, oder angehalten wurde. Das zu bewÃ¤ltigende Szenario eines Levels ist immer Ã¤hnlich: ZÃ¼ge mÃ¼ssen zu ihren jeweiligen Zielbahnhof kommen. Dazu muss man geeignet Schienen bauen, Weichen stellen, Kollisionen mÃ¶glichst verhindern und mÃ¶glichst wenig Zeit verlieren. Train Valley ist ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch. Durch die Aufgaben gewinnt das Spiel etwas an Abwechslung, aber es ist nach einer Zeit doch recht eintÃ¶nig. Trotzdem ist es ein recht kniffliges und nettes Spiel, das SpaÃŸ macht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067358822', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1699936935}
review:
Interesting game. I purchased it because I expected something "just" relaxing. However, I'm glad I get it because it is more challenging than I expected.

Similar to other games that are basic puzzles (like Angry Birds), this one has a similar score system (imagine the stars score, depending on what you accomplish, you can get 1 to 3 stars).

The gameplay is relaxing, chill and interesting. However, the challenge regarding the levels themselves is entertaining and draws me to come back again and attempt again that level.

I'm not a completionist (I don't seek to get 100% of each game I own), but certainly this game, even pushes me to attempt "something a little bit better than last time".

Recommended for you if you like planning games, being relaxed, not stressed because of the action, but maybe  a little active trying to find a good set of options to choose.

review:

Train Valley possui uma mecÃ¢nica de jogo simples, mas desafiadora. O objetivo Ã© construir trilhos para guiar trens coloridos atÃ© seus destinos, evitando colisÃµes. O jogo comeÃ§a de maneira descomplicada, mas Ã  medida que vocÃª progride, ele se torna consideravelmente mais complexo, exigindo planejamento e tomada de decisÃµes rÃ¡pidas. As fases apresentam diferentes desafios, como a necessidade de classificar os trens por cores, evitar colisÃµes e alocar recursos limitados.

Essa curva de dificuldade Ã© bem projetada. Inicialmente, os nÃ­veis sÃ£o relativamente fÃ¡ceis e servem como um tutorial gradual para ensinar as mecÃ¢nicas bÃ¡sicas do jogo. Conforme vocÃª avanÃ§a, os nÃ­veis se tornam mais desafiadores, com novos elementos introduzidos Ã  medida que vocÃª adquire experiÃªncia.

Train Valley possui uma estÃ©tica visual atraente com grÃ¡ficos simplistas e coloridos. Os trens e trilhos sÃ£o representados de forma clara e os ambientes sÃ£o agradÃ¡veis. A simplicidade visual contribui para a acessibilidade do jogo, tornando-o adequado para uma ampla faixa etÃ¡ria. NÃ£o muito distante a trilha sonora do game Ã© cativante e ajuda a criar uma atmosfera agradÃ¡vel e relaxante. Ela se adapta ao ritmo do jogo, aumentando a tensÃ£o nos momentos de desafio e fornecendo um pano de fundo agradÃ¡vel durante o jogo.

Train Valley oferece uma rejogabilidade parcial, os jogadores podem retornar as fases concluÃ­das para tentar melhorar seus tempos e classificaÃ§Ãµes em cada nÃ­vel. AlÃ©m disso, o jogo possui nÃ­veis de bÃ´nus desbloqueÃ¡veis, o que aumenta a longevidade do jogo.

Embora Train Valley seja principalmente um jogo de quebra-cabeÃ§a, ele tambÃ©m pode ter elementos educacionais. O jogo ensina sobre lÃ³gica, planejamento e resoluÃ§Ã£o de problemas, o que pode ser benÃ©fico para jogadores de todas as idades.

Train Valley Ã© um jogo divertido e desafiador que combina habilidades de quebra-cabeÃ§a, estratÃ©gia e gerenciamento de recursos. Sua curva de dificuldade bem projetada, estÃ©tica agradÃ¡vel e trilha sonora envolvente o tornam uma escolha sÃ³lida para fÃ£s de quebra-cabeÃ§as e jogos casuais. Se vocÃª gosta de resolver quebra-cabeÃ§as e gerenciar recursos em um ambiente ferroviÃ¡rio, Train Valley Ã© definitivamente um jogo que vale a pena experimentar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011534887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4754, 'last_played': 1698749709}
review:
Preso con i saldi e senza grandi aspettative, Ã¨ invece un bel puzzle game
Inizia con livelli semplici a "tutorial" per poi crescere in difficoltÃ . I comandi a disposizione sono: crea binario, elimina binario e treno aggiuntivo. In piÃ¹ cliccando su uno scambio si cambia la direzione di percorrenza, cliccando su un treno gli si fanno azionare i freni.

Ovviamente nei primi schemi Ã¨ banale, diventando via via complesso incastrare tutti i treni. Soprattutto se vi "obbligate" a fare tutti i 3 gli obbiettivi di livello, nella stessa run.

Mi ha talmente convinto che ho preso pure il DLC
Consigliato!

review: Started this game with mixed expectations, but it is actually a pretty neat puzzle game. Had a lot of fun playing through it. The only complaint I really have is that the difficulty curve felt off sometimes, with midgame challenges being tougher to beat than some of the latter ones, but in the end that didn't derail the fun. During sales you can buy it for a bargain, making it pretty much a no-brainer to get it.

review:
[b]My review to Train Valley[/b]

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]
+ Very difficult
+ 39 Steam-achievements (You need the Germany DLC)
+ Steam trading cards
+ Time management
+ Different types of trains
+ Very challenging game
+ Logical puzzle

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]
- No controller support
- The track switch is a little bit complicate
- The music gets a bit annoying in the long run

[h1]I do not recommend this game![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198138350339', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1693132459}
review:
Train Valley is a cozy puzzle game about trains. It features a simple yet variable mechanic of laying complex rail systems and managing trains by mostly switching the rail... switches in real time with pause.
You need to manage space between the station, your funds, and the demand, making sure that trains get to their respective stations as fast as possible. 
You would be surprised at how stressful the simple process of juggling several locomotives on a mess of a road system can be. Train Valley is really good at giving the player new challenges every few moments. It masters the experience of slowly ramping up difficulty on each level to almost impossible heights, just to slowly bring it down in the end.
It's like a train in that. A slow start, a gradual stop, and insane intensity in the middle.
One thing that could've used a bit of revision is the tutorial. It's enough, but it feels like it could be a bit more gradual. I somehow missed the message that you could pause the game, and it added a good deal of extra challenge to the early levels until I figured it out.
The game has a solid 10 hours of gameplay, not counting the DLC, the sandbox mode, and hunting for every single challenge. 
To be honest, I was a bit tired of the game towards the end, with its rollercoaster of railroading stress, but on the other hand, I found myself wanting to replay the levels just one more time to try and be a bit more efficient.
So, in the end, I would gladly recommend this game to everyone who likes a simple but challenging puzzle. I know that for someone, this game might become one of their favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296087794', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1690634422}
review:
The game is very nice.

I'd say its a very easy game HOWEVER if you make a slight misjudgement or tiny mistake it can cause a chain reaction of negative events... Everything is going smoothly then one train goes in the wrong direction and suddenly you lose track of everything else (no pun intended)

There is a couple issues I have with the game, the biggest of which is a known bug where a train will randomly explode. I think it happens to me mostly when i try to reverse them. Luckily it doesn't happen all that often but the game would be better without it. I got the achievement for my train crashing into itself because of this strange bug.

I also think it would be nice if you weren't bankrupt the instant you hit $0. The amount of times I go bankrupt WHILE A TRAIN IS ENTERING A STATION is crazy. You can stop me from buying track at $0 but bankrupt me at like -$2500 or -$5000 please. or maybe even add a timer after hitting $0 and if you don't go above $0 before it ends THEN bankrupt me.

This game is about $2 on sale and well worth the price imo even with the exploding bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978111218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1689809737}
review: I really like the concept (though it push the integrated GPU a bit too much, it could be done with less 3d effects). In short it is a puzzle where one has to manage trains going to various locations sharing few tracks. For those that like puzzles and trains it is pretty nice. The twist is that it also becomes hectic if one wants to play without pauses, one has to be quick in making decisions. Pretty neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337394702', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1688584440}
review:
Hi, This game is not super fun would not recommend it cause yes it's suppose to be fun but It is not and I would not Recommend this game to anyone on steam Waste of money Don't even bother with the demo for this game cause there is nothing good about this game on steam other then it's 100% Kid-Family Friendly.

If you want to get a good train game get void Train instead it's a much better train game and more worth the money and the demo is like beyond fun to play and a good use of time while playing it as well.

So I suggest don't waste your money  even when the game is on sale  and time with this game period .
reason why cause the game is not fun and the way you lay tracks is not set up well 
like placing them and 2 trains could possible crash before getting from place to place.
Whoe ver made this game should have done a few test runs before putting this game on steam to fix a few problems like the one I mention.

Cause even if you make 2 different track routes for trains the same thing can happen no matter what and the game can be complicated with one to many tracks on the game and it can be frustrating also to complete the objectives it has for you to do on the game as well unless you play the game in easy mode, that just takes the fun away from the game playing it on easy mode.

review:

Bei mir wurden es Ã¼ber 100 Stunden. Wahrscheinlich ginge es mit ca. 60h. Da ich halt 2 bis 3 Jahre Unterbrechung dazwischen hatte, hatte den Spielstand gelÃ¶scht, um wieder erneut zu Ã¼ben und alle mÃ¶glichen HeimtÃ¼cken zu erfassen.

Die Leveln ansich hatte ich in 30 bis 40 Stunden alle durch. Somit habe ich zweimal komplett durchgespielt. Es waren wirklich halt die Errungenschaften wo ich halt viel geÃ¼bt habe. Diese erfordern auch eine gute Portion Konzentration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341742588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2630, 'last_played': 1688397888}
review:
A puzzle strategy game with trains!

You must complete varying tasks on each level to earn money and stamps. Your ability to perfect higher levels will depend on being able to manage multiple trains (and tasks) at once and sometimes even think outside of the box - such as sending trains to the wrong station in order to avoid collisions. While some tasks may seem impossible to achieve, it can be done by using simple tricks (such as sending extra trains out early in a level as much as possible, instead of later).

The game offers just the right bit of fun and challenge without ever becoming too frustrating (though it does become very hectic at times). There is also a sandbox mode for each map so you can built to your heart's content. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055015198', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1683192612}
review: A friend got me this game and I thoroughly enjoyed playing through each and every level. Whilst you might think that it would get repetitive you would be wrong, each new area adds a little something, be it different behaviours to the trains or unique map encounters. My only complaint is that they have achievements attached to the DLC, still though I would recommend getting and playing through the DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018299969', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4984, 'last_played': 1684148346}
review:
Very challenging game which is enjoyable to play.
I have to admit that some levels are much easier than others, certainly if you want to get the 'three' stamps but that's what makes it nice to play.
I would recommend everybody to play this game if you want to play solo, challenge your brain but in a way it's light and hardy.

review:
(game not complete at .7 hours) 
Not for me but I can see the appeal, more of a puzzle game than a casual train game.  I wouldn't say this is relaxing the constant demand to maintain time schedules and the unknown placement of future stations makes this game more nerve wracking than relaxing.  Not a bad game just not for me. $10 price point is fair for this game in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040530605', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1680344038}
review:
[h1] Deltius Reviews Train Valley [/h1]

[b] Summary [/b]
[list]
	[*]Immersion: N/A
	[*]Graphics: 5/10
	[*]Audio: 5/10
	[*]Story: N/A
	[*]Bugs: Clear of Bugs
[/list]
	
[b] Details [/b]

[i] Immersion: [/i] N/A
[i] Graphics: [/i] Cute and suitible for the game but not that impressive either
[i] Audio: [/i] Sounds are nice if you like trains like I do.
[i] Story: [/i] N/A
[i] Bugs: [/i] Non-exsistant

[b] Recommendation [/b]

Train Valley is an enjoyable game that focuses on getting each train to it's matching station (colour coded) and is a relatively fun and deceptively challenging game. However, I would recommend you check out Train Valley 2 which is a marked improvement and still hits that puzzle solving train themed fun.

The train valley series is one of the best casual transport management games ever created. 
Strips back all the nonsense of transport strategy games leaving only the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199096237817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1672169085}
review: It is easy to understand how to start not too complex, it is a management train game. The time passing and quotas to finish the levels are arbitrary to me and I am left just building my railroad till it just stops sending trains and ends. I like the simple puzzles to solve with a little penalty and the little explosions are fun. things I would add are a clear time or quota on the start achievements screen before the level, and the ability to change the rail clipping sensitivity this is a personal issue. Warning before the end of the level to know when the last train can be sent. but it's a fun game and good visuals and diverse levels and puzzles I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041503938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3608, 'last_played': 1672441999}
review: You can call it a train management game if u want, but in fact it's a mind blowing puzzle game that starts easy and than adds wood to its engine and ask you to put all your senses to the task and pay attention to many little details, at the same time, The fact that almost of all the maps can be start every time you play it in different ends of the map, and that there is never one solution only add to the fact that this is a game for people that like to think... and make it fast... and of course... if u like trains like me it's another big plus. The only down size: a little bit short and only one DLC as they moved to TV2

author: {'steamid': '76561198155709139', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1669668949}
review:
Train Valley is a great stoppable real-time train puzzle game, so why am I not recommending it?

Because it is so buggy that the current "very positive" verdict of the Steam crowd is a bit too good, and because there is an excellent, mostly bug-free alternative with better presentation, more varied game mechanics, and far more content: Train Valley 2.

[h1]The game[/h1]

Each level takes place on a mostly fixed map that fits on the screen, with only some minor obstacles randomized. In the beginning there are only a few railway stations which you must connect; then more and more pop up. At certain times a train appears in one of the stations, in the color of another station -- indicating where it wants to go. Building tracks, destroying obstacles and hurrying trains cost money, and there is also an annual tax. The only source of income is delivering trains to their destinations.

The game is over when you are bankrupt. You win if you reach the end date.

The game consists of 4 stages (pages in a book) consisting of 6 levels each, for a total of 24 levels. The stages take place in Europe, the United States, the Soviet Union, and Japan. There is also a DLC available which adds a fifth stage of 6 levels taking place in Germany. Sometimes history is made while you are playing a level, having some effect on the game.

Every level is represented by a postage stamp. The first 5 levels of each stage are regular levels, in which you try to get the postage stamp stamped three times by satisfying three constraints such as not crashing any train or not sending any train to a station other than its destination. Technically you can get these separately on three different runs, although if you want a challenge you will insist on doing them all at once. The final level of each stage is mostly unrestricted free play, where you try to maximize your score.

With my experience from playing the sequel, I finished the entire game in under 30 hours. After that I was looking forward to the sandbox levels, but these turned out to be the regular levels in what feels to me a completely pointless and uninteresting mode.

[h1]Comparison to Train Valley 2[/h1]

The sequel has far more content already in the base game. The basic mechanics are more complicated because you are dealing with supply chains: transporting goods that are required for building other goods. Nevertheless, Train Valley 2 manages to start with a reasonably moderate difficulty that draws you in before it progresses to almost insane levels, always taking you with it. The original Train Valley mechanics is also implemented in Train Valley 2. It appears in some DLC levels and in some user-contributed levels.

Unlike the present game, Train Valley 2 is very polished and professional-looking and mostly bug-free. I haven't finished Train Valley 2 yet, but I love it so much that it was obvious that I had to play the present game as well. It was a nice experience, on balance, despite the annoyances. Whereas I can recommend Train Valley 2 without any reservations.

[h1]Annoyances[/h1]

There is a major bug that causes trains to crash for no valid reason. Possibly a family of such bugs. Some maps seem to be affected more than others. It is unclear whether restarting the level, or the game, typically makes a difference or not. It's a bit too rare and unpredictable to fully analyse, but far too frequent to ignore. Sometimes I restarted a level several times in a row because each time my first or second train left the station, it crashed immediately on a perfectly fine piece of track.

There is also a number of more minor annoyances that were mostly fixed in Train Valley 2. Both games don't always register button clicks. What makes this worse in the present game compared to its sequel is that the immediate feedback for stopping a train is a bit too subtle, so you can easily miss when a train doesn't react to your emergency braking. Usually not as dramatic in effect but far more concerning is the fact that very occasionally I got the confirmation sound after clicking the button to start a train in a station, and then it turned out that this was ignored anyway!

In both games, when a train rolls over a switch, it turns red and you can't change its position. In this game, this also happens to nearby unrelated switches, sometimes preventing you from setting them to prevent a disaster. This is one of the occasions where one would want braking to work reliably.

Compared to its sequel, it is incredibly frustrating how long it takes for trains to leave the station. This really messes with the tight scheduling that I got used to with Train Valley 2. Also, in this game if you stop a train you can't start it before it has come to a complete standstill. Since both stopping and starting take a lot of time, it is very hard to do minor adjustments. In Train Valley 2, you can interrupt the stopping process and restart the train, so the train
just slows down for a while. Once you are used to this, you really don't want to miss it.

Given the train crash bug and the user interface problems I just described, it was a really bad idea to make  'do not stop any trains' a relatively common requested achievement, in addition to 'no train crashes'. It is a testament to the quality of the underlying game idea that this game became so popular despite this blunder. Train Valley 2 has an option to always start the game paused; that would have been welcome here as well.

Unlike its sequel, this game sometimes does a poor job of communicating. When does a level terminate normally? Is it a specific date? A certain number of trains? What's the deal with the extra trains? Why are they sometimes not available yet, and why can they become depleted before the quota of extra trains has been met? Clearly there are simple underlying rules, but they are not transparent. When you have to do, or not do, 10 things, say, it is sometimes not clear what 4/10 is supposed to mean. If you concentrate on the game, not the notifier, it's not clear enough whether it counts upwards or downwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993899544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1670064781}
review:
This game reminded me of my father all alone in his special room for hours surrounded and entirely filled by his model train set.

I would peek in sometimes to watch him through the crack in the door, occasionally sneak in to look closer at this fascinating little world it was worth the punishments.

After my mother threatened to leave him he begrudgingly dismantled it and hid it all in the loft away from me, so I finally had a bedroom of my own but I think he always resented me for this.

After the divorce he had it all put in storage for years until a break in meant it was all stolen, God knows how much money all those little trains and carriages pristine still in their box's were worth.

When I was a child did he ever wonder if I might also love trains or feel the urge to share this passion with me, no he did not.

At least he could have passed it down to me, so I could have shared it with my children, but no he only hoarded and locked it away until it was ultimately all lost forever.

Now I sit all alone a sad 40+ year old man playing with my very own little digital trains with no one to share them with, Thank you for everything you taught me Dad now I have become you I hope you are proud.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987334319', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1502068814}
review:
Train valley is a fun, small scale puzzle game. 

You get to route little trains around a valley, matching them to their destination without hitting the others. There's some time pressure, but variable speeds allows you to mostly set your level of pressure. 

Great for people who like guiding shapes into their proper boxes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001656330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1664950381}
review:
This game is alright for an hour or two. That's a bit much for $10. For $3 to $5 this is a good for a couple of hours if you are bored one night. Overall it's kinda fun but it has 0 depth.

The first level is basically everything you will need to discover. Stations pop you release trains, trains arrive at destination you win/lose. That's it. No tech tree no progress no choice beyond the timing of your clicks just 20-ish repetitive levels with increasing complexity. This is very similar to "brain games" that you can find on phones it's all about timing an multitasking. Quickly you will find yourself pausing the game so that you can keep track of the 6 trains you have on the map. So yeah there is very little interest IMO. 

It's important to note that you can pause and turn around the trains by clicking on them. I didn't realize this at first and I was going mad after 30 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203148594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1690994962}
review:
Beautifully crafted and extremely fascinating game. This will get more difficult and intriguing as you go along.
To the game's developers: I think it would be a great addition if the player could create any kind of rail tracks and any number of stations in the game, similar to the free roaming mode found in NFS. Therefore, on that canvas, we are not limited to just accomplishing problems.

But overall, I really enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025100013', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1662480619}
review:
Auch wenn mir das Spiel gestellt wurde, hier meine ganz ehrliche und eigene Meinung. AnfÃ¤nglich wirkt Train Valley gemÃ¼tlich und wuselig, die Herausforderung lÃ¤sst aber nicht lange auf sich warten. Zwischen den Weichen und Windungen der Strecken kann es schon einmal eng werden. Das ergibt eine wundervolle Mischung aus SpielspaÃŸ, Nervenkitzel und dem Willen es noch besser zu schaffen. Jedes Level kann mit optionalen Zielen abgeschlossen werden, um eine bessere Bewertung zu erreichen. Damit halten schwierige Level auch nicht im Fortschritt auf. Das nÃ¤chste Erfolgserlebnis ist nie weit und mit mehr Erfahrung kann man alte Level noch einmal besser bestreiten.
Die Grafik ist angesichts der nun sieben Jahre Alter hÃ¼bsch anzusehen und absolut stimmig. Aus heutiger Sicht wÃ¼rde man sich ein paar mehr Lichteffekte wÃ¼nschen und ein wenig mehr abgerundete Objekte. Das ist aber etwas fÃ¼r die Nachfolger. Hier ist grafisch alles in bester Ordnung. Auch der Ton und Musik ist abwechslungsreich und nie stÃ¶rend. Hat man einmal die SignaltÃ¶ne verinnerlicht, helfen diese gut dabei einen Ãœberblick zu behalten.
Ein paar Punkte lassen sich noch bemÃ¤ngeln. So ist das Wirtschaftssystem sehr gering und bietet kaum Informationen Ã¼ber die Einnahmen und voraussichtlichen Ausgaben. Lediglich ein einziger Kontostand wird angezeigt und so bin ich das ein oder andere Mal durch irgendwelche Kosten in den Bankrott gestolpert. Hier wÃ¼rde ein wenig mehr Ãœbersicht zu Steuern weiteren Kosten helfen. 
GrundsÃ¤tzlich lassen sich die Schienen gut verlegen und die Steuerung ist recht intuitiv. Manchmal kommt es aber vor, dass sich an EngpÃ¤ssen zwei Enden einfach nicht verbinden lassen, was zu mehr UmbaumaÃŸnahmen fÃ¼hrt. Wenn beim Bauen hier die Karte deutlicher erlaubte oder zu steile Winkel anzeigen wÃ¼rde, wÃ¤re das nachvollziehbarer. Auch lassen sich Kreuzungen nur in GÃ¤nze Abbauen, sodass man die verbliebene Strecke wieder neu bauen muss. Das ist nicht sonderlich schlimm, kÃ¶nnte aber einfacher sein.
AbschlieÃŸend kann ich das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der kleine Knobelspiele mit einer gewissen Prise von Nervenkitzel mag. Mich hat es sehr unterhalten und noch bin ich nicht am Ende angekommen. Viel SpaÃŸ euch allen mit dem Spiel.

review: Train Valley ist ein wunderbares Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch. Ich spiele es gerne als kleinen Zeitvertreib. Die Grafik ist angemessen fÃ¼r das Spiel und die RÃ¤tsel werden noch richtig kniffelig mit der Zeit. Schade ist nur dass nichts zur Geschichte gesagt wird die man da etwas nachspielt.

review:
Love the base game! Really cool levels with different themes and sometimes extra challenges. All really fun, some a bit tricky but doable. The base game took me a little over 10 hours (some replays of levels included).
It is a bit random and sometimes hard to plan, i have to agree with some of the other reviews but the levels are still quite easily completed with 3 "stars", especially because you don't have to complete all challenges in the same run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273010303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 3407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1660461086}
review:
[h3] Good strategic puzzle game. [/h3]

Some levels can be rather challenging and require a lot of concentration.
Each level can be retried as many times as needed to gain the 3 goals without being reset each time.
Using [Pause] is very useful for planning and laying/removing tracks.
The order of events on each retry is random which adds to the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842647056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1666182989}
review:
Great little game.
Build a simple rail network to get trains to the correct station.
Easy, once you start, but soon gets tougher, much tougher.
More stations, more points to switch, more and faster trains.
Not long before there are trains crashing all over the place.
Simple cartoon graphics, keep it frustratingly fun and addictive. (Just one more go)
Audio is excellent, clean simple so you can hear when trains are waiting.
4 levels (Base game), Germany dlc adds 1 more level. Which isn't playable until the
base game is completed. I purchased as a bundle.
6 Scenes to each level I can see this staying on my pc for some time.
Lots of replay value
20hrs to play all scenes, inc DLC, got around 50% achievments
I will still play to get 100% achievments

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1657311617}
review:
I really want to like this game, but I ended up so frustrated I became bitter. It seemed like a charming chill game where you make a stylized diorama of trains, but I hate it.

Maybe I suck at the game, I don't know, but here's my beef with the game.

Too much randomness destroys any possibility for the player to make meaningful decisions. The terrain, stations, trains, train length, train speed, time they automatically depart, cargo value/destinations are completely random every single time. You enjoying and completing the level is almost entirely at the mercy of randomness. It is impossible to know what is going to happen which means everything is up in the air at all times. This isn't fun, quite stressful, and gives the player little agency in their strategy on top of juggling all this in real time. This overbearing amount of needless complexity kills the game dead in the water.

It is very unforgiving. Money is always very tight. You will go "Bankrupt" very easily. The game has maybe 20~25 levels, so it seems in order to prolong the experience, the difficult ramps up fast. I could not get passed the 6th level.

The tile based grid that the game is based on is large, which means that you will frequently bump into objects that cost money to demolish, non-movable objects cause the map to be very cramped, and the trains take up quite a bit of space on the rails. Judging a train's speed, ability to start and stop in very specific places on the limited track you can build with a tight budget, and micromanaging switches and trains is frustrating. You will need to create "Y" intersections quite a bit, which can run afoul quickly in tight areas.

Switches automatically move when a train goes over them. When there's dozens of switches and you seem positive you have a train on the right track and the game is playing 4-D chess with you, suddenly your train will be going the wrong way into the wrong station or another train.

The developer seems sincere, but the game has a lot of technical challenges they seem unable to fix. Trains explode for no reason sometimes. Their vision for the game probably isn't going to change and I don't think it's well designed. Maybe I'm missing something, but why is the default action always the "Switcher" tool and not the "Track" tool. The first thing you'd want to do is build track because there's no switches yet. I'm not even sure what the Switcher tool does. How can you possibly do anything other than click on a specific switcher which already is allowed while other tools are selected.

My solutions, to the best of my ability to imagine is the following:

Trains and stations need to be color coded. Currently there are icons over the train and station which is cluttered and confusing. Simply and intuitive it is not.

A train's path should be drawn over the tracks in a line its respective color so one can better visualize the route it will take as a toggle option.

Trains should not automatically pull out of a station. Challenges should revolve around the player making the choices of when trains leave the station and better optimizing their routes. This gives agency to the player and sets optional difficulty by how fast they want to tackle completing the level for time or money.

The levels should not be random with the ability to toggle it to random for optional challenges either before the level or unlocked after you complete the level.

AI for the trains to prevent imminent crashes or reroute. If you think that makes the game too easy, it's not when there's 6 trains on the tracks with complete random variables. There is too much micromanaging for my liking for the game to be enjoyable. Trains should also stop and start much quicker. Time is money in this game, and allowing trains to stop automatically or take an alternative path still penalizes you if you aren't paying attention. It would probably be a lot less frustrating then your trains exploding.

The challenges should be from the extra objectives. If the player can't beat the game casually, then it's probably too strict.

I do not recommend this game, and did not enjoy it. Even if you like trains, I wouldn't recommend it. As a management game, its real time nature is overwhelming. As a puzzle game, it does not contain puzzles, because puzzles let you know all the pieces before hand to allow you to figure out how to solve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063498280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1710656204}
review:
I am really enjoying time with this little train puzzle game so far. It seems like one of those games that can be enjoyed equally in both long hauls (pardon the pun) and short spurts as well. I really like the challenge level. This game can really push your brain and reflexes if you want to complete all of the stars (challenges) but it wisely allow progression with completing all of the individual challenges per each layout/mission, and that was really appreciated. It's challenging as all get up, in classic mode, but they included a fun sandbox mode to hone your skills, while scratching that creative itch. 

*DISCLOSURE: I bought this game during the Steam Summer Sale, but have a strong feeling having played it now, that I would recommend it a full price, and Train Valley 2 is now on my wish list as well.

CONCLUSION: I'll keep it simple. If you are a fan of trains, and enjoyed challenging puzzle games, this would be a STRONGLY RECOMMENDED BUY from me - with one caveat: If you are looking for a train-transportation-tycoon-style-sim, this game IS NOT that.

review:
https://youtu.be/iGIbtOlJBKY

Train Valley is a simple train management game, where you go through history to complete missions and while on those missions you need to ensure that your trains don't crash, which is harder then it looks since you forgot to change a switch in the game and all of a sudden 2 trains are running into each other. Overall the game is really easy to pick up, and if you are good at concentration this game is going to be really fun for you, in most cases I forgot I had changed something and trains ends up running into each other! Then I restart and try again.

I have attached some gameplay so you can see if this is a game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198872166164', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1684933994}
review:
Despite the genre listings of "simulation" and "strategy", this is really a puzzle game, not a builder or sim, so if you're looking for something like a Railroad Tycoon game, then you won't find it here.

The game as a Puzzle Game: Good idea, and it's fun when it works. But the game has a few major flaws that makes it incredibly frustrating. There is a timer that appears only when there are 5 seconds left before the next train. If you have anything in that range, there's very little you can do especially when the levels are complex.

I was enjoying the game for a while, but the train management is just far too frustrating for complex levels. I can't recommend the game until the developer fixes issues like this, and revamps some of the track management. 

The game itself looks decent, though buggy and frustrating with issues, it just isn't what it looks like it is on the store page.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048735141', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1946, 'last_played': 1654524205}
review:
A great management game to chill out.
Train Valley has a nice toy graphics, a peaceful music and lots of trains.
You build rail routes, junctions and try your best to not cause a catastrophe.
The game itself is not super hard, but getting all stamps for all quets can be tricky.

Train Valley was super fun for me.
I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968566119', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1653863191}
review:
Fun puzzle game, which increases in difficulty slightly then tremendously. Each map has 3 elements to win, which you only need 1 to pass on to the next stage. Some challenges are to: Never stop a train; Never let a train enter the wrong station; Never destroy a track; Spend enough; Don't spend too much; Do destroy objects worth enough $; Don't destroy objects worth so much $; etc.

I stopped after I couldn't complete one board which escalated the difficulty significantly which started with all railroads turned one direction, but the requirements were to connect them all in reverse. I tried to solve it for over an hour, but had to stop for the day. Every tiny mistake ended in failure. Even the randomness of the board's spawns could cause failure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258753615', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1674402075}
review:
Parafraseando a TotalBiscuit, Train Valley es un rompecabezas en tiempo real. Es divertido y frustrante al mismo tiempo. La complejidad del juego avanza a medida que vas armando las vias donde los trenes pasaran para ir dirigirse a sus estaciones correspondientes.

Los niveles se dividen por temporada, cada una de estas situadas en diferentes 5 diferentes paises, y uno de ellos viene en formato DLC, por lo cual si quieres completar el juego en su totalidad, debes desembolsar algo mÃ¡s de dinero.

La ambientaciÃ³n de los mapas son muy diversos, pero debido lo frenetico que llega a convertirse el juego, no da tiempo de si quiera detenerte disfrutar el paisaje o como se transporta los trenes de manera calmada, ya que todo se va acumulando, y si no liberas el trafico a tiempo, todo se termina convirtiendo en un caos. Esto es para mi uno de los puntos mÃ¡s negativos del juego.

Si buscas un juego para divertirte armando vias y ver a trenes ir desde el punto A al punto B sin querer frustrarte o desesperante en el proceso. Esto no es para ti.

Pero si quieres poner a prueba o ejercitar tu mente para buscar soluciones y completar retos, Train Valley te lo entregarÃ¡ sin ninguna duda.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981412938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1677955740}
review:
It's an action puzzle game about choo-choos and chuga-chugas in which you place tracks to avoid trains smashing into each other. Or do it on purpose to get the achievement.

Quite addictive. And nicely constructed rail system just makes you feel good.

It's very similiar to an old DOS game I loved as a schoolboy, not sure if it's from the same creators or not. But it's funny that there're at least three train puzzle games with the same gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1642723380}
review:
[code]Puedes ver mÃ¡s reseÃ±as como esta en la mentorÃ­a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Realmente divertido[/h1]

La premisa de Train Valley no podrÃ­a ser mÃ¡s simple: llevar a los trenes a su estaciÃ³n. Esto, que es una simpleza, esconde una jugabilidad realmente entretenida y bastante retadora en muchos momentos.

A travÃ©s de diferentes escenarios tendremos que ir construyendo las vÃ­as que unan las diferentes estaciones y hacer que los trenes lleguen a la estaciÃ³n adecuada. Sobre el papel suena bastante simple, pero luego la cosa se complica en la prÃ¡ctica.

La razÃ³n para esto es que las estaciones aparecerÃ¡n a veces en lugares donde habrÃ¡ que pensar muy bien en una estrategia a la hora de construir las vÃ­as, ya que nuestros recursos son limitados y vamos perdiendo dinero cada poco tiempo a modo de impuestos.

En poco tiempo tendremos una maraÃ±a de vÃ­as con varios desvÃ­os unos encima de otros, todos ellos llevando de una estaciÃ³n a otra y donde tendremos que estar pulsÃ¡ndolos para variar el recorrido correctamente y que todo funcione como deberÃ­a. En sÃ­, sÃ© que puede sonar un tanto simple, pero el resultado final es algo realmente divertido.

Durante el juego visitaremos 4 paÃ­ses diferentes con 6 escenarios por paÃ­s a cada cual con mayor complejidad. En todos los paÃ­ses empezaremos a principios de siglo pasado, con esos trenes de vapor lentos, e iremos avanzando aÃ±o tras aÃ±o hasta llegar al siglo XXI con los trenes de alta velocidad como protagonistas, mucho mÃ¡s veloces y por lo tanto mucho mÃ¡s complejo de manejar todo. Sin embargo, tendremos la opciÃ³n de pausar la acciÃ³n en todo momento para poder plantear la estrategia correctamente.

AdemÃ¡s del juego base tambiÃ©n existe un DLC que incluye seis misiones mÃ¡s ubicadas en Alemania, y te recomiendo que si te gusta el juego base te plantees hacerte con Ã©l tambiÃ©n porque aÃ±ade nuevos escenarios y retos a los ya existentes.

Cada escenario tendrÃ¡ tres objetivos que cumplir a modo de extras y podrÃ¡n ser muy variados. Algunos serÃ¡n gastar X dinero como mÃ­nimo o como mÃ¡ximo, hacer salir a X trenes extra de las estaciones, no chocar ningÃºn tren o evitar que un tren equivoque su estaciÃ³n, entre otros objetivos.

El juego como tal es un tÃ­tulo sin pretensiones, que lo Ãºnico que pretende es hacerte pasar un buen rato mientras diseÃ±as vÃ­as ferroviarias y haces que todo funcione como deberÃ­a. Y desde luego que lo consigue.

Su apartado grÃ¡fico es bonito y aunque no destaca especialmente en nada cumple perfectamente con su funciÃ³n. Exactamente lo mismo para el apartado sonoro, donde los temas musicales nos acompaÃ±arÃ¡n en cada momento y serÃ¡n un aÃ±adido que harÃ¡ mÃ¡s entretenida la experiencia.

AsÃ­ que ya sabes, si te gusta la estrategia y los retos y quieres pasar unas 15 horas montando vÃ­as y dirigiendo el trÃ¡fico ferroviario como si tuvieras una mesa a escala en tu casa, sin duda este juego colmarÃ¡ tus necesidades y harÃ¡ que te diviertas bastante con su simpÃ¡tica propuesta. De hecho, puede llegar a ser bastante adictivo en determinados momentos.

review:
I really like this game BUT ...

I would have given it six stars out of 10 if that had been possible. The graphics are nice, controls are simple, I didn't find any bugs, and play is challenging BUT ...

THERE IS NO SAVE!! So you can spend a bit of time working on a setup but you can't come back and finish it later. No! When you exit the game everything you worked to build is gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859599796', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1708949210}
review:
Train Valley as a simulation of a toy train set, pitched in a puzzle environment with rules, challenges and restrictions.

I have never been interested in trains or toy trains owning a toy train set.  I am now 41 years old and I am enjoying this game so much that I wonder if this is my midlife crisis.  Maybe I will now buy a train set.

I am playing through the campaign mode - about halfway through so far.  Each level consists of a map with various obstacles and terrain and two or three train stations.  As time passes, trains appear in each station with a destination marked on them and every now and again additional stations appear too.  Your job is to build the tracks and to control the switches that guide the trains to their destination.  When a train reaches its destination you receive income.  The quicker the journey, the more you will earn.

Switches are automatically added where tracks connect.  You may lay track that crosses over other track, destroy previously laid tracks and destroy obstacles, such as trees or buildings.  Building tracks and destroying obstacles costs money and as time passes your money decreases under the guise of annual taxes.  When trains crash they blow up and damage everything around them.  It's quite fun :)

You successfully complete a level if you reach the end of the time allowed without going bankrupt - exploding trains are fine, but don't run out of money!  There are other challenges for bonus points, such as earning a certain amount in a given level or avoiding trains crashing, things like that.

Is it fun?

Yes.  Not bad.  I got this on discount for less than $1 and it's really good value for money.

I really feel like I am building a toy train set and guiding trains around.  It can be very satisfying optimising routes around the map and watching your toy trains pass within tiny spaces of each other, but not colliding.  It has a good feeling about it when you do something clever, probably once or twice per level.

This is NOT a transport simulator, it is not an intense puzzle game and it's not a management sim.

This IS a fairly simple puzzle game, building tracks and guiding toy trains to their destination.  It is not particularly challenging, but not totally casual either.  You will have to concentrate and plan and have the restrictions of budget holding you back a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041524040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1656262446}
review:
A fun game. The graphics obviously aren't overwhelming, but they are more then good enough for what this game is trying to be.

The distinction between worlds and the gradual learning curve make this a good game to pick up quickly, but you still notice a significant improvement on your skills in the late game compared to early game. The challenges make you think on your feet and add a nice, optional extra layer of difficulty on top. I've finished the base game in about 15 hours (after which i'm now writing this review), but that's a good amount of time for a good game. If you don't care about the optional challenges, you're probably done in less time, but who plays a game like this if they don't want to see how good they can get?

The DLC seems to be priced fairly for the amount of content it provides from what I can tell, so if you see me having played more since this review, you know I got myself the DLC to dabble a little more in some train valley action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214378207', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1614766952}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052707118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3152, 'last_played': 1659907673}
review:
A great game, somewhat reminiscent of 'Locomotion', an ages old game where you had to direct trains to the corresponding station. However in 'Train Valley' you don't only direct the trains but you have to build the very tracks aswell. This alone does add up to the fun immensely. Also you could put more trains on the tracks as you see fit. Of course this will not only increase the amount of money you can earn, but it will most definitely rampi up the difficulty to sometimes insane heights.

Graphics, sounds and music are perfectly fine for a game of this kind and the developers did put quite a lot of details in the game as well. For example you will start out with slow and old trains that are reasonable short and easy to navigate around the tracks. But that's only the beginning: Later on during the levels the trains will get more modern, faster and longer.

Still that's not all. There are hidden gimmicks in the levels that will appeal to yourself during gameplay and keep everything fresh and fun. Of course I won't mention them for the sake of letting you find out for yourself. You most likely will, because this is a classy game you should definitely add to you library. And while you're at it, please do beg the devs to release more levels in the form of DLC in the future. Thanks in advance. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561199099159316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1641771532}
review:
Don't let this game fool you; Despite the cute looks and the nice colors, I've found gameplay to be difficult, even on the easy maps & gamemodes. This game is good in overall simplexity of where to send trains to and how to do it. It seems simple at first, but just wait till you click on the infinite symbol available at the end of every level.

For me, it seemed so simple and complicated so easily. I sometimes built tracks right as the trains were rolling through em. Other times, I knew exactly what to do and became focused.

I would recommend this game, but only for people who would be a lot better at it than me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032028808', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1641746897}
review:
A lot of potential, but ultimately the game is more infuriating than it is a satisfying puzzle game. Too much randomness and babysitting signals (sometimes at low speed to ensure you don't miss any since a single mistake can ruin your level, so you need to be risk averse) for it to make a good puzzle game. 

I gave it a few tries since it does have a bit of a nice addictive feel to it, but each time after 15-40 minutes it makes me so annoyed I just turn it off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378894513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1659850233}
review:
I've never considered a career in the railways other than the occasional, childish dreams of cruising along the rails in an engine cutting through the country from one town to another. So when I saw the warm, colorful title in my recommended I was intrigued and soon found myself eager to appease my sense of adventure, entreating those child like fantasies to the opportunity that laid before me. At first I found the game to be rather fulfilling, crafting literal bridges between communities by building an effective locomotive network and watching the trains gracefully push towards their destinations.
Then, things started to get a little different. The number of depots just kept growing as did the number of trains needing to traverse the railways. I felt the pressure but I was buckling down and making it work. Sure a few departures were delayed, and the rail networks I've crafted weren't always perfect and needed some revisions but it continued to function just well enough.
 But the demand and growth just kept rising and rising and rising. I began to feel overwhelmed. I scrambled to direct each engine to their appropriate destinations with careful planning and navigation. Trains were left sitting in depots for what felt an eternity and after leaving often needed to stall to allow passage of another locomotive on the same circuit. The intensity of it all became too much and I found myself unable to cope with the pressure and turned to the bottle. At first it was just to take the edge off, but it wasn't long before I was sneaking whiskey on the job. 
Then one day... the unthinkable happened.  I sent two on their way but I wasn't careful enough. The damn booze, I got sloppy and I didn't notice I sent them right at each other. By the time I realized it, it was too late. Those poor bastards slammed right into each other and both trains were completely destroyed. They died, and it was entirely my fault. An investigation took place and as soon as they smelled the vapors on my breath it was the end for me. Then it got real ugly. Before I was just tipping the bottle but now, I was swimming in it. I lost my house, wife, kids and everything with any value to me. 
Things were bleak, and i did some things to get by that I wasn't too proud of but nothing compared to the shame I felt from the men who died because of my ineptitude. One day, after wondering around for years, I sat next to some tracks and watched a train pass by. I was immediately reminded of those fond dreams living a peaceful life on the rails. It was just the inspiration I needed to finally climb out of that bottle. I decided that I would carry on that dream and that I would carry on the memory of  those who died as a stern reminder to never bury my responsibilities again. I have a long road ahead of me and have a lot to prove before I'm ready to take the reigns again, but if I steel my resolve and stay true to the course I'll find my way back on top in Train Valley.
So yeah I'd say it's a pretty fun game. A bit challenging at times and can be a little trial and error but you learn what works and what doesn't and apply what you learn moving forward. Would recommend to anyone  10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021141277', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1641053399}
review:
Its.... Really nice, but its REALLY simplistic, although it can get QUIIIIIIIITE hard early on if you aren't paying attention. You gotta be a genius at multitasking to be able to fully do all the objectives for this game

Imagine "Mini Metro" but ACTUALLY done right, and made complex, without the same cool aesthetic.

So why did i refund it? Because honestly there's not much more to the game. I still think its good, but I dont think its good enough to grab my attention because of how simple it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561199156895515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1705333939}
review:
Apenas lo instalo y ya me clave 4.6 horas, una locura este juego de trenes. Si no lo conoces que es lo mas seguro, es un juego donde debemos construir vias y conectar las estaciones para que los trenes circulen entre ellas.
Si a primera vista parece una cagada pero es bastante dificil y tiene bocha de pantallas que nos ponen a prueba para no chucar los trenes y con el dinero que nos dan hacer todo esto sin quedar en banca rota.

Los [b] MODOS DE JUEGO [/b] son dos: 
Clasico: basicamente es pasar los niveles con una que otra mision.
Sandbox: donde haremos lo que queremos sin limite de dinero y solo por diversion de ver los trenes pasar o chocarse entre si.

Realmente denle una oportunidad si les caben estos juegos xq este es muy bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561199192694649', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1663795355}
review: I enjoy laying the tracks and routing the trains. I wish there was more levels available. I already purchased Germany DLC and almost beat the game with all three stamps (or stars) on each level. I actually purchased Train Valley2 and honestly like the original better. The look of the game, the graphics, are better in Train Valley and I even would say the object of the game gives me more pleasure and satisfaction.  I've spent more time playing Train Valley than Train Valley2 although purchased at the same time and contains less courses.

review:
A relaxing strategy game that is fun. Dont know why there are no more DLCs, only one. The game has a Good idea. Devs could keep on making more content, cause the lenght of the whole game is between 3-4 hours (for no complitionists). (only possibility is to replay the same maps over and over. Tried the Train Valley 2 as well, but this one I like even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028903083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1662864316}
review:
Train Valley 2 just went on sale, and that reminded me that I had this earlier Train Valley.  It has languished, almost unplayed, on my drive for quite awhile.   Out of curiosity -- almost not remembering it -- I fired it up this evening.   Now I can't figure out why I didn't play it much.  It's actually an interesting little game, with charming graphics.  And it runs perfectly on my rig.  

Indeed, now I've decided to buy Train Valley 2 and its DLC while it's on sale, too.   That's a pretty earnest endorsement of the original.  I haven't seen it get quite difficult yet -- although I expect that to be coming, given comments in some other reviews.  But I must say -- the user interface seems pretty well designed, so if it gets very difficult it also seems that  I'll have only myself to blame if I can't solve whatever challenge it throws at me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995654179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1636682151}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089531410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1682539299}
review:
OK, das hat anfangs noch sehr viel SpaÃŸ gemacht, aber leider hÃ¤lt sich der nicht ewig! Woran liegt das? Nun, zuallererst mal daran, dass nicht wirklich viel Abwechslung geboten wird. Viel schlimmer ist aber die Spielmechanik.

Eigentlich kÃ¶nnte das ganze ein nettes Gelegenheitsspiel sein, dessen Level man immer und immer wieder spielt und versucht die Konstriktion zu verfeinern. Gerade auch weil das Spiel mit wenigen Bedienelementen daherkommt macht es zunÃ¤chst ja auch vieles richtig, der Teufel steckt aber im Detail, und damit kommt auch der Frust: 

Wieso kann ich nicht abspeichern? Gerade bei den schwereren Level nervt es, immer wieder von vorn beginnt zu mÃ¼ssen, wenn man eigentlich mal eine solide Grundlage gebaut hat. 
Wieso gibt es keinen Timer, der mir anzeigt, welcher Zug wann losfÃ¤hrt und wie viel Zeit noch bleibt - ich mag das nicht manuell wo aufschreiben, und spÃ¤testens, wenn sich 8 ZÃ¼ge gleichzeitig neu ankÃ¼ndigen, dann schreibt man entweder mit, oder kriegt zwangslÃ¤ufig einen Crash. 

Leider weiÃŸ das Spiel die KomplexitÃ¤t auch nur damit zu steigern, indem es mÃ¶glichst viele ZÃ¼ge gleichzeitig reinwirft - das ginge besser, z. B. mit grÃ¶ÃŸeren oder komplexeren Landschaften. Auch die dauerhafte Budgetknappheit, das mangels Geld kaum formbare Terrain, die superlangsamen ZÃ¼ge (die Zeit beschleunigen gibt es zwar, aber das fÃ¼hrt auch schneller zu neuen ZÃ¼gen, bringt also nix), die fehlende MÃ¶glichkeit nur einzelne ZÃ¼ge zu beschleunigen, die ewiggleichen und auch blÃ¶dsinnigen Aufgaben, etc. lassen leider eher Frust aufkommen und zeugen davon, dass das Spiel in diesem Teil noch nicht ausgereift ist. 

Ich bin also abschlieÃŸend etwas hin- und hergerissen. Denn das Spiel an sich hat soo viel Potential! Auch weiÃŸ ich, dass es einen zweiten Teil gibt, aber im Moment schreckt mich der erste Teil eher vom Kauf des zweiten ab und drum kann ich den Teil auch nicht guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198111787165', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1636254004}
review:
Stress, Aniexty, Fun & Pain...

These are all the things you will feel as you race to not only construct, but also conduct the trains on your line to safely get them to their correct coloured home. When you first jump in, you'd be forgiven for thinking this is a game for kids, but boy o boy does this game ramp up. Very quickly you'll have lines running everywhere, and trains coming at you from every angle.

Sit down, grab your choice of caffeinated drink, and watch the hours fly by, as you try and get your trains home safely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179284646', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1679682278}
review:
I bought this game the same way as I imagine a lot of us here did, as a part of the elegant engineering bundle.
I thought the price of the bundle was fine for Poly Bridge, Turmoil and Minimetro and just tossed this game aside. 
Years later I thought I might just try it for a few minutes and damn me; this game is actually pretty cool!
I really enjoyed the difficulty curve and I loved the moment when my head clicked with the game and I finally managed to multitask multiple trains at the same time.
The music is fine, the visuals do their job and I have barely encountered any glitches.
All in all this is a throughout 'fine' game, if not very ambitious. 
Just keep in mind its a puzzle game not a city builder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048814614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1634945649}
review:
A simple little train management game where you have to figure out how to get all the trains safely to their stations.
It looks very simple, and frankly old-fashioned, but it is highly addictive.
The learning curve is not very steep, but it does get harder as you progress, with some of the later levels needing you to keep cool and stay focused as more and more trains are waiting to go out it can get a bit stressful.
You can do a half an hour game session, but it is easy to spend hours just figuring out where exactly you went wrong in your last try in the later stages.
Replay value is good if you want to finish all the levels with the full set of extra objectives.
I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002831274', 'num_games_owned': 1574, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1632815782}
review:
J'ai dÃ©couvert Train Valley en jouant Ã  Train Valley 2 bien avant. L'ayant adorÃ©, je me lance dÃ©sormais dans le premier.

Un gameplay plus simpliste et bien moins contraignant. Presque trop simple Ã  mon gout, surtout quand on a terminÃ© tous les niveaux du second avec toutes les distinctions ! Ici on se contentera d'apporter des trains vers une autre gare. Pas de systÃ¨me de "craft" avec un acheminement de ressources diverses comme le second mais Ã§a reste plutÃ´t sympa.

Les niveaux sont jolis avec une 3D simple mais rÃ©ussie.

( Je ne peux pas noter la bande son vu que j'exploite le jeu dans un environnement oÃ¹ je ne peux pas faire de bruit [strike] bÃ©bÃ© dort et doit restÃ© endormi [/strike] )

Un peu court comparÃ© au second opus et sa ribambelle de niveaux tous plus diffÃ©rents les uns que les autres. Comptez ici 4 chapitre dans l'Ã©dition de base avec 5 niveaux chacun.

A prendre Ã  tout petit prix puis lancez vous dans TRAIN VALLEY 2 qui est vraiment une rÃ©ussite !

author: {'steamid': '76561198107401538', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1607629694}
review:
Si au debut le joue est plaisant, trouver la meilleure trajectoire pour placer les rails  fin de destination efficace des trains, sans trop "se melanger les pinceaux", on arrive vite a un niveau ou clairement on se pose la question suivante, si le jeu n'est pas fait pour echouer, ni plus ni moins. Et, on en arrive a de la frustration, sentiment tres negatif. A moins que le but reel soit simplement de faire echouer le joueur ?! 

Bref : passe ton rail, non pardon, ton chemin, ainsi tu ne risques pas d'arriver sur une voie de garage inutile et instatisfaisante. ;-) 

:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198023776638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1624792386}
review:
It took a little bit of getting used to. You have to build the tracks and set the switches manually, and it gets frantic when there are multiple trains all swanning about. As far as I can tell you can't stop trains either, they just go off until they reach their destination... or crash. And blow up all the tracks around them.

So I was screaming in chaos initially because from level 2 onwards, 1x speed really is necessary, the pause helps a lot, and the sandbox mode is very useful for planning! But the game doesn't really tell you about any of those things. But it is such a beautiful well made game that I did not have it in my heart to refund it. I don't know when I will pick it up next but I am sure I will at least have fun looking at the game even if I am not making much progress with the campaign.

review: I bought this because my toddler loves trains.  We would spend time sitting together and playing the first few levels.  Lots of things to teach him about colours and shapes.  Just about around or after page 2 it definitely becomes a more grown up game and I loved it.  Quick to play, nice level design, lots to learn as you go, good sound design too.  Fun with my son and a different kind of fun on my own.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971188245', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1622902514}
review:
Whether you succeed at level has more to do if things randomly spawn in an order that allows you to win rather than skill or planning. An example:
 - build tracks, put train on track to destination.
 - town spawns in middle of track, destroys train and rail line.
 - not enough money to build new lines, get charged tax, lose game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131926054', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1547660467}
review:
Recensione completa: [url]https://www.tanadelcobra.com/train-valley/[/url]

Train Valley eâ€™ molto appagante. La sua grafica cartoonesca dai colori caldi eâ€™ molto rilassante, e nonostante serva parecchia concentrazione per portare il livello fino al termine, la difficoltaâ€™ non eâ€™ mai eccessiva e con una buona pianificazione, ed a volte un paio di tentativi, la pagnotta si porta sempre a casa.
Ecco, forse il limite di Train Valley eâ€™ qui: ci sono solo 20 livelli, e non sono troppo impegnativi. Ci sono tre obiettivi da raggiungere in ogni scenario, che puoâ€™ essere completato anche ottenendone uno solo; davvero troppo semplice. Per allungare la longevitaâ€™ personalmente non ritengo un livello concluso fino ad aver raggiunto tutti e tre gli obiettivi, ma certo eâ€™ un palliativo. Non câ€™eâ€™ un level editor e il sandbox mode non eâ€™ altro che la rivisitazione degli stessi livelli finiti in precedenza. Un DLC aggiunge 6 nuovi livelli, ma il prezzo di 2.5 Euro eâ€™ secondo me eccessivo.

Voto: 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198008749599', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1619467432}
review:
This is exactly what I wanted from a train management game. The gameplay is more arcadey and action oriented. No complicated mechanics, just a simple, straight forward, get the right train to the right station type deal. 

There are 5 stages with 6 levels each. The last level in each stage is focused on high score but the rest give you 3 objectives to complete as an added challenge or for the completion achievement. Last stage is unfortunately a paid DLC but it is only a few bucks. So you build your tracks and as new stations pop up, you expand or adjust those tracks. The rest of the gameplay is just managing trains â€“ who goes first and who goes after. The trains are constantly popping up and it can get really hectic, especially at some of the later levels. The pause button is your best friend, as you will be pausing after pretty much every train to make sure its route is clear. This whole process was very engaging to me. I had to really think about the correct order of operations and when everything went smooth, it felt satisfying.

It would have been nice to have some additional features or building options (I do think some of these are available in the sequel), but it was not necessary. Sometimes the simple way is the better way. If you are looking for a train management game that is more fast paced and action oriented, this would be the game for you.

review: There is no automation. Where is the automation? I do like the challenge of setting up the rails in a way of maximizing throughput, but I don't like that I have to micromanage the trains, due to a lack of automation signals. That's just tedium. This game could be a lot better. I'll go back to Factorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965272491', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1636579665}
review: This is an incredibly relaxing, yet stressful game.  It plays well, is simple to learn but offers challenge.  The goals will be repetitive, however achieving those goals in ever changing landscapes is what keeps the replay value high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823065180', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1619641551}
review: played TV2 happily, and based on some reviews, TV1 supposed to be even better. Can't agree, this building process is way more flat, just stations, trains are too slow, budget is the biggest issue, and is less challenging despite constant mission restarts after EOY bankrupcy (very expensive railroads + train moves so slowly it takes literally one year from A to B! that's NOT what i'd like to watch). Building of railtracks is also so slow I often don't realize that a dispatched train might crash. It's still great tho. But it's just 20+5 missions vs 30+20 missions, way lasy gametime! I like TV2 direction and hope to see TV3 soon. With some twist, like buses or people visible on the streets, or households, or bigger maps, or more weather. I don't get why a nice night atmosphere in some missions in TV didn't appear in TV2. The series easily beat all train games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992487271', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1618785814}
review:
TLDR; This is an amazing gem on Steam and worth every penny at full price.

I play shooters aka COD etc., I play games like GTA Online, Red Dead Online, Destiny: Big AAA games.... I even dabble in roguelite games ala Hades and Dead Cells. But I'm not saying I'm a robot trained to play only big money games or super popular games. Just like everyone else I find small gems every once in a while. This is definitely one of those gems. It does feel like a mobile game, but I literally just looked it up on my android and it didn't find it lol. I'm glad steam can claim this as an amazing PC exclusive, at least as far as I can tell. This is an amazing rendition of the popular Air Traffic Control games from mobile phones but with trains via laying train tracks instead of drawing paths for vehicles, so if you loved those you'll love this. Just get it. Even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147807823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1665538769}
review:
I wish I could do a 'neutral' review.  [edit- I changed to an up-thumbs because i think the game executes as planned...and so why should it get a negative because i was hoping for something else?]

This game is exactly what I worried it was from the video - a switch-management game. So, if you are into the micro-management of trains, and view track placement as a puzzle, this is a great game for you. 

I you want a strategic game to employ trains to build a transportation network, this is not the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373924597', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1612411491}
review:
Terrible little game!

If the devs didn't even care making maybe at least a 5 min tutorial...Why did they even bother making a game then?!

And EVEN if I had been smart enough to figure-out how to build proper junctions to avoid those stupid trains to constantly crash into one-another: From the videos I have seen and the absurd tracks design you have to come-up with to have a chance it all works out, the game remains unbelievably boring as there is way to much hands-on work, and very little fun to have here.

At least do NOT expect a little management / train tycoon or railways simulator here. All this 'game' is, is a poorly made and boring puzzle game!
