author: {'steamid': '76561197984266509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1528837340}
review:
Direct as many trains as quickly (and safely) as possible to their appropriate stations.  Unfortunately that's all there is and you've seen it all after the first couple levels.  I got about 50% way through the game (IN TWO HOURS!!!  This game is DAMN short.) and nothing was added from the first level.  The gameplay is cute at first, and a level's terrain will occasionally make things interesting, but there's just not enough here.  

I've also failed a couple levels because I was doing too well.  You can send out additional trains for a fee.  If you get good enough, you can have about a half-dozen trains going at once.  Unfortuntely, if you're doing this and the first of the year tax comes about, you can go backrupt even though you've not made any actual mistakes and you've got several tens of thousands of dollars about to come in from trains arriving.  

All in all, this game doesn't do anything that a game like Mini Metro doesn't do better.  I STRONGLY suggest looking into that before getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369733562', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1574193583}
review: Nice relaxing little puzzle game. It's very addictive (I played 22 hours in 3 days...). The graphics are cute and colorful. I'm not sure about replayability yet - I have almost beaten all levels with all the bonus objectives and I don't know if I will keep playing after beating them all. The sandbox mode is very basic, without money or any objectives at all, and you have to spawn every train manually which makes it not very fun for me. All in all I think this game is good fun and worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052496516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1600894395}
review:
Very good game, playable, immersing. It is surprising at first when You realize how much it can entangle You. I thought of it like a 30mins game, but then woah 2h later... And another h...
I recommend this for players who like to plan and build, correct, or speed up the game. Maybe not for everyone, but play the demo or have a look other way and You will see.

-- The money display could be more shown and alerted of when low. But after some time I got used to, and sensed when I should look at the money.

++ I feel that train specifics are good, realistic, adding to the game. Well, it is not a pixel perfect game where You have to squeeze trains as much as possible. Who does that?
I had situations where I had to stop two or three following trains because of a slowdown somewhere near the first train.

As for trains changing the railroad switch setting when passing from the two tracks into one it is realistic. And it's not an issue for me.

Also, the train length is sometimes a bad news for You, especially at higher levels, or Japan world. But it doesn't seem too random.
Costed me a few restarts, but I feel like that's the spirit of it.

review: Disappointing. I thought this game would be more like a city-sim, except focused just on railroads. Its nothing of the sort. Its a short series of simple puzzles. It should be a $1 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091997989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1527011872}
review:
Train Valley is a puzzle-strategy train simulator game. Player needs to build railways in order to connect cities. Rails are cheap, except when demolishing houses or other objects. The player has to manage increasing traffic by constructing crossroads and switches.

good graphics
good gameplay and effects
good sound and music
4 chapters (24 missions)
------------------------------
I recommend this game !
good little game...

review: I hate that I love this game so much! The style is unique and well-designed, and the progressively harder levels keep you on your toes. Itâ€™s simple and intuitive to learn the controls, but difficult to master. I often find myself yelling at my monitor when a train goes into the wrong station while I wasnâ€™t looking, but the frustration is part of the fun. Overall, excellent game and well worth the purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011761529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1266, 'last_played': 1528066909}
review:
Great game, realy addictive. Once you start a level you want to finish it with all stamps. And all you say when it not worked is "just one more try". Then all of the sudden an hour or two are gone. 

+ Very simple to learn, no big tutorials required
+ very diverse levels 
+ quite challanging when you desire all stamps
+ simple and great working interface
+ cute grafics

- can lure you into spending more time then you wanted ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1525465393}
review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut.

Es ist ein Eisenbahnspiel, dessen niedliche Aufmachung verbergen kÃ¶nnte, dass es eine ziemliche Herausforderung ist, das jeweils entstehende Chaos eines Levels zu beherrschen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1377868922

Das zu bewÃ¤ltigende Szenario eines Levels ist immer Ã¤hnlich: ZÃ¼ge mÃ¼ssen zu ihren jeweiligen Zielbahnhof kommen. Dazu muss man geeignet Schienen bauen, Weichen stellen, Kollisionen mÃ¶glichst verhindern und mÃ¶glichst wenig Zeit verlieren.

Je frÃ¼her ein Zug ankommt, desto mehr Geld gibt es, das man meist dringen braucht, um weitere Verbindungen zu legen. Denn im Laufe des Levels kommen meist neue BahnhÃ¶fe "aus dem Nichts" hinzu. Zudem steigert sich die Zahl der abfahrbereiten ZÃ¼ge zu einem schweiÃŸtreibenden Stakkato. Man kann zwar bestimmen, wann ein Zug abfahren soll, wartet man aber zu lange, so fahren sie von alleine los (und bringen auch kein Geld mehr).

Oft hilft nur noch, einen Zug anzuhalten, ihn in die entgegengesetzte Richtung fahren lassen oder ihn (das geht) zwischendurch in einen anderen Bahnhof einlaufen zu lassen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1377871652

Wenn das alles nur immer so vom Spieler geplant und gewollt wÃ¤re. Oft genug passiert es ausversehen, weil man gerade mit anderen Dingen beschÃ¤ftigt war. Es ist ein zuweilen stressiger Spass, einen Level zu Ã¼berstehen zu wollen (man muss wohl eine gewisse Zeit durchhalten).

Damit allein hat man zwar den Level geschafft, aber noch keine Lorbeeren gewonnen. Es gibt in jedem Level drei Nebenausgaben (z.B. eine bestimmte Menge Geld ausgeben oder keine UnfÃ¤lle zu bauen), die teils deutlich schwer sind.

Der Ablauf der Level ist Ã¼brigens teils zufallsgesteuert, also insbesondere wann wo welcher Zug bereitsteht.

Insgesamt gibt es in etwa 24 Level und das reicht schon mal fÃ¼r ein hÃ¼bschen Zeitvertreib von vielleicht 5 Stunden. Wenn man alle Lorbeeren will wird man (wahrscheinlich) sehr viel lÃ¤nger brauchen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1377872596

Die Grafik ist einfach aber fÃ¼r die Zwecke ausreichend.

Der Sound ist OK. Die GerÃ¤usche sind relativ wichtig, um neue BahnhÃ¶fe und abfahrbereite ZÃ¼ge einfacher zu bemerken.

Die Steuerung mit der Maus ist denkbar einfach und funktioniert problemlos.

Es gibt sehr viele Errungenschaften, fÃ¼r die man schon einiges tun muss.

Pro & Contra:

+ Das ausbrechende Chaos ist sehr spaÃŸig
+ Die Spielidee ist zwar schlicht aber unterhaltsam
+ Gewisser Wiederspielreiz

Wertung: 9/10

Das Spiel fand ich zuerst doch merklich schwer (zumindest bzgl. der Lorbeeren), aber als ich mich an die Hektik gewÃ¶hnt habe, war es richtig spaÃŸig, die ZÃ¼ge (nicht immer erfolgeich) zu steuern.

review: A great micro-management strategy puzzle game. Place tracks to get trains from A to B, but you have limited money to spend & generate more by successfully delivering more trains. Try to juggle as many trains as possible to get the most from every level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993065448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1522604913}
review: I very much enjoyed this game, and spent several days getting three stamps on all the levels.  The aspect I appreciate most is the game is challenging without resorting to cheap mechanics.  Every time I failed I felt like it was my fault, and I could have done something better.  Looking forward to the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011046672', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1523442821}
review: Ich kann nur abraten, nach nur 4 Std. genervt deinstalliert, ist eher ein Geschicklichkeitsspiel als Wirtschaftssimulation und schon mal gar kein Railroads Klon, wer was fummeliges zum Spielen sucht, ist hiermit wahrscheinlich gut bedient. Allerdings Strategen, Aufbautycoone und Wirtschaftsmagnaten sind mit anderen Spielen besser beraten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035768427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1542905857}
review:
Really fun game! It's not too difficult, but at times especially if you want to complete all extra tasks(stamps) it can be challenging. It's a bit short, but maps are repeatable. Music is nice and relaxing.

It's a good choice for anyone looking for a game to play casually and who likes simulations with problem solving and planning.

Germany DLC is fun and more challenging then rest of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993326992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1522809196}
review:
The concept is nice. A simple little game for managing train schedules. However, I find some of the gameplay elements infuriating, making me not want to continue playing.

The big ones I've noticed so far (and admittedly, I haven't gotten past the first world) are that:
A. I have no idea how long a train is, so scheduling them to mesh well with each other has a non skill based (random) factor that is annoying to deal with.
B. Trains accelerate VERY slowly. This I guess is a gameplay element, but multiple times I'd gotten a nice mesh between trains only to find out the lead train was still accelerating, so the rear train caught up with it, and then both exploded.
C. There's no warning when you're low on funds. I can't count the number of times I was building a new rail spur in december, only to suddenly get game over because I'd run close enough to zero that when taxes came around I was suddenly bankrupt where I'd had 10s of thousands of dollars seconds before. 

I think if these issues were addressed, it would be a much more fun game, at least for me. Perhaps others like these as added challenges, but I really wasn't a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967354699', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1507589468}
review:
Very fun game if you like trains and timed challenges...

Some trains may collide and explode, some may not do what you want, and most important, some will appear when you don't want them! :D
But it's a good game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011365080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1525599884}
review:
Train Valley is pleasant, fun, and challenging. It's more a puzzle and timing game than a transport sim.
 Each game is 10 minutes or so with set objectives rather than massive empire building. 

I really wasn't expecting Train Valley to be good at all, but at $1.50 and looking like a train game, thought i'd give it a go for a few minutes amusement. Instead i found it to be great, worth the $10 asking price, and bought copies for friends.

Many transport and town sims could learn from Train Valley something about friendly interfaces. Many puzzle games could learn from it something about fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979505422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1523248236}
review:
Great little puzzle/strategy game - expect to get a good 10-20 hours out of it... DLC is an extra 6 levels that feel more difficult then the base games 24 levels... worth playing I would try to catch during a sale vs full price. 

If you do not like 'micro-management' aspect in puzzle/strategy games skip this... and go find something more tycoony ala BigPharma. If you do like the series, there is a 2nd one that just came out and appears to have good reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066018737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1522604758}
review: Imo the game is great - simple graphic, you need to focus and it's perfect for train lovers. It's a pity there are only 5 sheets with tasks (6 with DLC Germany)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995776115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1710800495}
review: Great puzzle game, with a hint of management. The way the surroundings, trains, music, etc evolve through time (1800's to today) and space (Europe, US, Russia, Asia) is pretty neat too. No need to be a train-lover (I'm not) to enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996819268', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1524332640}
review:
Definire questo gioco non Ã¨ stato poi cosÃ¬ facile. Train Valley Ã¨ un puzzle game/gestionale con protagonisti i treni, ad ogni partita il giocatore deve costruire e gestire la rete ferroviaria tra diverse stazioni. Lâ€™obiettivo primario Ã¨ organizzare ordinatamente la disposizione dei binari, collegare le stazioni e far viaggiare i treni gestendo gli scambi evitando di farli scontrare. Inoltre ad ogni scenario verranno assegnati dei vincoli od obiettivi da rispettare, per esempio evitare di demolire strutture oltre tot valore  oppure facendo partire dei treni aggiuntivi, il tutto con un budget limitato che non dovrÃ  mai scendere a zero, pena game over per bancarotta.
Il gioco Ã¨ suddiviso per ambientazioni, Stati Uniti, Europa, Unione Sovietica e Giappone come contenuti base, inoltre Ã¨ presente un dlc dedicato alla Germaina. Le ambientazioni si differenziano solo per lâ€™aspetto grafico e la musica che contribuisce allâ€™atmosfera, il gameplay non cambia. Ogni ambientazione Ã¨ suddivisa in una manciata di scenari con vari obiettivi piÃ¹ uno scenario libero in cui viene assegnato un punteggio finale.
A livello tecnico il gioco Ã¨ molto semplice e leggero, la grafica 3D Ã¨ elementare cosÃ¬ come il sonoro, i rumori ambientali sono il minimo indispensabile. La colonna sonora Ã¨ gradevole ma come accade spesso in questo genere di giochi le poche tracce presenti fanno presto a diventare ripetitive, anche se variando per ambientazione questo effetto per fortuna Ã¨ limitato. I controlli sono semplicissimi, si fa tutto con il mouse, piÃ¹ qualche comando da tastiera che puÃ² far sempre comodo, per esempio lâ€™essenziale tasto pausa con la barra spaziatrice.
Concludendo consiglio questo gioco perchÃ© Ã¨ semplice e divertente, venduto ad un prezzo base giÃ  piuttosto contenuto che puÃ² essere anche scontato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1524165077}
review:
Ma passion pour le transport fÃ©rovier n'a pas de limite ^^

C'est un bon petit jeu, le principe est simple et finalement assez diffÃ©rent d'un OpenTTD/SimuTrans. Les deux buts du jeu sont :
1) maximiser les profits 
2) Ã©viter les collisions

Vous ne gÃ©rez pas de ligne Ã  proprement parler, mais juste des trains unitairement, vous ne gÃ©rer pas non plus ce que transporte vos trains (voir TV2 ^^).

Le jeu possÃ¨de environ 5h de jeu pour dÃ©bloquer toutes les cartes (sans rusher), vous pouvez monter Ã  10/20h pour faire tous les succÃ¨s (suivant votre skill), la difficultÃ© n'est pas vraiment prÃ©sente puisque seul les deux derniÃ¨res cartes offrent un vÃ©ritable challenge (sur la quarantaine de cartes disponibles). Comme tout casual game, une partie ne dÃ©passe pas les 10 minutes. De plus les cartes sont toutes riquiqui.

C'est donc plutÃ´t agrÃ©able Ã  jouÃ©, la musique est redondante mais pas Ã©nervante

author: {'steamid': '76561197971948490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1867, 'last_played': 1571109176}
review:
This wasn't what I was expecting.  I was expecting a game like transport tycoon made more simple and kid-friendly that I could let my niece play when she came over.  (She likes trains.) Instead, this game is basically one of those traffic-manager games, although it does feature pausing.  Space is severely cramped, forcing multiple trains to share the same tracks since there isn't room for the parallel tracks you'd normally use, and so managing traffic flow and multitasking are the name of the game.  

It does fortunately have a free mode where there is no time limit.  This is fun even for a child, especially since making a mistake and making things explode when they crash is also fun for a child.  It's not quite the model train set she likes playing with, but it's good for something that doesn't take up the whole floor or half an hour to lay out.

That said, the buttons are really small.  Even with the interface scaling turned up as high as it goes, buttons are small even for me as an adult, and it's a real problem for my niece to be able to actually hit the buttons with a mouse, which she can only barely control.  

One thing that really frustrates when I try to play it, however, is that the missions can frequently be luck-based.  Some of the Japan missions, in particular, basically mandate restarting until you get a good start.  The sixth mission in every chapter is mostly randomized... and it can place obstacles that are too expensive to destroy right in the way of the only good routes.  If that happens, RESTART, SUCKER!

The way you are expected to get extra money to stay afloat, for another example, is to spend money to cause extra trains to spawn... but how much money getting those trains to their destination gives you is totally random, and can be less than the cost of making the train spawn in the first place!  If that happens early in a mission when the budget is tightest, then you have no choice but to restart.  Again and again and again.  

Then there's a real problem with the lack of feedback with your cash reserves.  Money is displayed in a tiny box in the corner of the screen, and your only warning you are getting low is the faintest, most ignorable red pulsing of the numbers.  You know, in a game all about demanding your attention in six different locations at once.  You lose the game the instant you hit $0, and you have to pay taxes every "year". It turns out that trains take several months past when the engine enters the station to when you actually get paid, so many are screams of frustration when someone loses a game they were winning because the train was slow in paying you.  Also, train speed and year length change from mission to mission, so you never get a good sense of how long anything is going to take. This is especially problematic when building things/needing to pay fines for demolishing buildings in the way because you think you're fine with $10,000 to spare in the bank, but then it takes two whole years for a train to actually make it to a station so your winning game is ruined by the inconsistent pacing of the game.

It's fairly light, cute, and can be fun in smaller doses, although it's a chore if you're trying to get completionist.  The free mode is the best part, and it's a good toy for kids when you take away the failure state.  It's just a pity that the developer thinks things have to be hard to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057247401', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1525159669}
review:
Si te gusta locomotion, o esos juegos tycoon de transporte, como a mi, este juego es genial.
Tiene misiones que parecen tontas, pero hay que prestar mucha atencion para no cometer errores y conseguir todos los sellos...
Es muy agraciado en lo que a graficos se dispone, y luego el manejo de transporte es muy simple, ni siquiera diria que es manejo de transporte, si no que seria una especie de ejecutor de vias y caminos. El tren se anuncia y tenes que dirijirlo por las vias (que vos construis) a la estacion correcta. No construis ni trenes, ni estaciones. Solo las vias, y manejas los cambios de vias... que simple no?

Yo pense eso, y por eso lo compre estando en oferta... y... (como dirian los hermanos "6" espaÃ±oles) MENUDA SORPRESA, TIO. Es un gran juego que me hizo viciar un rato, y todavia no lo termino, pero yo creo que los que nos gustan los tycoon, nos gusta este juego, a pesar de su simpleza.

PROS: lo que dije. simple, entretenido, te quema una neurona en ciertos casos o cuando tenes 10 trenes dando vueltas y evitar que se choquen puede ser algo desesperante. Buenos graficos.

CONTRAS: tal vez la mismas que las pros. Simple en su funcionamiento, pero no por eso poco entretenido. A veces se buggea y terminas un nivel con todos los sellos y no PASA NADA... o sea, no pasas de nivel, ni entras en quiebra, nada... se buggeo, y otra vez a hacer el nivel. Otro punto malo es el menu... CHICOS, MIAMI, FACEBOOK... haganse un menu vieja.

Resumen: Si te gustan los juegos tycoon de administracion de transporte, ADENTRO. Y si no, tambien. Es mas que nada un puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992783558', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1522994127}
review:
A quick paced game where you have to lay tracks to meet requirements. Trains spawn at one station, and need to get to another station. You have to lay tracks and route them there without colliding with other trains that are spawning at the same time. Each map is small and pretty quick to play through, it's not like a tycoon game. 

I really enjoyed playing this game from start to finish, I recommend it to anyone who's interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397484604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1521829864}
review: The first few levels are really fun but I quit after the second page. The trains will constantly leave by themselves, often 3 at a time and then simply crash into each other. You likely then can't add more track after the track has exploded because there's no money and you go bankrupt. It's sad, I was really enjoying this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992635689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1568333971}
review: Nice concept but NOT for casual gaming! I do not recommend this game unless you are hardcore into time and money management to find the optimal track layouts. Trains set out after some time whether you have money for more track or not. Very frustrating after the fifth map. I'd rather have my $10 back than spend another hour on this trying to advance. To bad, it had potential. Maybe I'll look at it again in six months to see if some cheats are out for it. There is a sandbox mode but it only works with maps you have already tried so it doesn't help much with game mode time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008182182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1522618344}
review: Its is a fun little train game. The levels are kind of one offs with no massive scale till later on but not to big.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026334814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1515338619}
review:
I absolutely love this game! And I don't even like trains or any kind of train game. I mean... it's freaking trains! 
But the puzzles in this one are great and quite challenging. The graphics are lovely (and really cute) and the different landscapes never make it boring. I def. wouldn't call this game a simulation though. It's a puzzle and strategy game that goes all the way from easy to "I need a video on youtube to show me how this is done"-hard. 
I really enjoyed it and I'm looking forward to Train Valley 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300747804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1581824536}
review:
The levels and some of the advanced achievements are fun to get.  Going for all the advanced achievements could be frustrating but there is a lot of gameplay even without those.

You can pause the game by pressing space and also stop and reverse trains by clicking on their engine.  Even so the game gets challenging in later levels.  Trains will launch on their own if you don't get them dispatched soon enough.  Many level require resourceful deployment in order to keep ahead of the train schedule and make enough money not to go bankrupt.

The soundtrack is very catchy!  This isn't a relaxing puzzle game so much as a logistics challenge.  Satisfying when you get a tricky network running with several trains at once.

I would buy it on sale.  The game play is not open ended as with a train management simulator, each level is a contained network that runs its course and then ends.  You probably won't get hundreds of hours out of it but it is fun for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329824009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1634, 'last_played': 1625971277}
review:
You may be on the fence about spending a few dollars for this game.  Do I really like trains, you ask yourself?

Listen to me.  You LOVE trains.  And you need to buy this train game, because it's GREAT.

GAMEPLAY
-build a series of tracks, and guide trains safely to their destination, managing periodic taxes and building expenses
-or, make the trains collide intentionally, you madman
-accessible at several levels of skill, good for younger audiences
-the levels scale very well, teaching you the mechanics of play in a very natural manner
-tracks switch with an incredibly satisfying sound
-the maps and music are very relaxing... almost too relaxing...
-zzZZZzzz  *BOOM* oh GOD the 11:15 to St. Petersburg
-oh the humanity...

MY EXPERIENCE
-toot toooot
-chugga chugga
-*BOOM* oh god NOT AGAIN

9/10 would catastrophically derail the 7:16 to Salt Lake City again

also, it has a sequel, and that looks REALLY nice, and I am going to buy it

author: {'steamid': '76561197971054185', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1523179809}
review: If you are expecting a model train simulator where you build tracks then sit back and delight at your new setup, you will be out of luck. This is more of a puzzle game where the levels get progressively harder requiring careful placement of track, switching of track points and above all ensuring that each train gets to its designated station without crashing into other trains. You will need to be quick thinking and plan ahead. This game does have the frustration factor so be prepared.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020785379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1522595251}
review:
You might be a bit put off by the graphics - but it's a fun and engaging train (track) management game. The game idea is fairly simple. You build tracks, deploy trains and flip railroad switches that decide which track passing trains will take.

The game challenges you with limited amount of space and funds, increasing amount of trains and stations and the multitasking of having to juggle your trains to their destinations. All while trying to clear level challenges.

I personally find this game relaxing to play, but also a healthy source of frustration.

The downsides are that the music can be a bit jarring after a while, the game has no real story and drawing the tracks can feel a bit wonky in the beginning.

I recommend it to anyone who thinks that they could enjoy the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073135544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1558878916}
review:
Excellent game. Very fun puzzle game about managing trains and rails that manages to stay fun and not fall victim to the micromanagement that some games fall into.

Only major flaw: this game isn't all that long. I could certainly see paying more for it if it had more levels. But for a $10 game, it's definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056559458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1556761916}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000845028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1598030835}
review: This game turned out to be a lot more challenging and a lot less relaxing than I initially thought.  Bought it thinking my kids would enjoy the simple gameplay, but then the controls were too complex for them to master.  So I ended up playing it myself.  It takes a lot of quick strategy to get all your trains to the right station without crashing and without running out of money.  Make sure to take full advantage of the pause feature so you can plot out your train paths in advance of dispatching trains.  Overall I enjoy this as a change of pace from other games so I gave it a thumbs up.

review:
+ easy to learn, hard to master
+ good pacing of difficulty
+ small, high end pc is not required

- sometimes tracks are layed out not in the way you would think they would. rare, but it's occuring from time to time
- stressful when you see two trains are about to crash :)

overall, good puzzle game. I reccomend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159778941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1493265220}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086864317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1583705795}
review: A fun game when it works.  I have been a Steam member for 4 years, and this is the first time I have purchased a game that works sometimes, and at other times it won't even load - just a black screen after an error message pop-up.  What is worse, the developer provides no fix, and Steam won't stand behind it because it has been played.  I will not buy another game from this developer.   Save your money for a more trustworthy and reliable source.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285679840', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1629020250}
review:
So I got this game in the Jingle Jam Humble Bundle last year, I never looked at the game or watched the Yogscast play it, but I downloaded it as I did with all the Jingle Jam games. I got my sister and I to sit down and play.
I you are searching for a puzzle game that gets increasingly difficult Train Valley is for you. When we first played we easily put 14 hours into it in one go, when you have to plan for unexpected turns and tracks appearing. The best thing was that it was Trains, I mean who doesn't like Trains. Throw in an Indie Puzzle game and you got a winning agme right there
Love it and Recommend it Highly

author: {'steamid': '76561198002880881', 'num_games_owned': 3512, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1516295671}
review:
Train Valley Ã¨ un gioco dalle premesse e dalle meccaniche piuttosto semplici. A prima vista potrebbe sembrare di trovarsi davanti un gioco manageriale, ma giÃ  dai primi minuti di gioco si capisce invece che il gioco Ã¨ molto piÃ¹ incentrato sull'aspetto puzzle.
Se Ã¨ vero che la pianificazione della costruzione delle rotaie Ã¨ fondamentale per il superamento degli scenari e lo Ã¨ altresÃ¬ la gestione dei fondi a disposizione e guadagnati, fin da subito Ã¨ evidente che l'attenzione del gioco Ã¨ spostata sulla microgestione, piÃ¹ che sulla macrogestione. SarÃ  infatti sempre fondamentale tenere gli occhi aperti per assicurare che i treni arrivino alla stazione giusta e che non si creino disastrosi incidenti.
Il mix fra puzzle, manageriale e strategico e al contempo quello fra gioco frenetico che richiede attenzione costante e gioco rilassante (stiamo pur sempre parlando di treni) Ã¨ senza dubbio ben riuscito.
Dal punto di vista tecnico ci sono alcune cose che andrebbero riviste, come alcune scelte di design poco azzeccate (per esempio le stazioni che durante la partita compaiono nella mappa fanno scomparire istantaneamente le rotaie se erano state costruite nella zona di spawn della nuova stazione).

author: {'steamid': '76561198169186261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1519172427}
review: Some relaxed, casual puzzle/strategy entertainment. Pretty good actually. You get a little brain workout when you've got a lot of trains running at once. I like to play a level here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071517027', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2674, 'last_played': 1517646913}
review:
A friend gave this to me as part of a bundle they purchased, as i thought it might be an inoccuous (if not casual) traffic-puzzler type game.

That being said, this game offers enough depth of gameplay and a fair amount of difficulty to waste multiple hours if you're willing to invest a bit. Though it does have some drawbacks.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]Easy to pick up, difficult to master - every level has an 'optimal layout' that you can only nail down after at least one playthrough. The real game lies in how you're routing trains and paying attention to the junctions they use. Timing can also play a factor if you're trying to cram the lines with as many trains as you can.
[*]The level objectives provide obtainable and often difficult ambitions beyond getting through the level without blowing up any trains (some levels have objectives that ask you crash trains together!) Often it's infeasible or downright impossible to get all the objectives on one go, begging for replays from a completist. 
[*] A whimsical view of various historical events from launching the first space shuttle to the falling of the Berlin wall, but without some tacky story attached.
[/list]

It's for these reasons I decided to purchase the Germany DLC and logged another 5-7 hours.

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]An amount of RNG that makes many levels/objectives frustrating, just about everything that happens in a level (station appearances, what station a train spawns at, it's destination and the placement of obstacles) can make it aggravating to complete certain objectives.
[*] Simple sounds & music, wound up turning them off after a couple hours.
[/list]

If you enjoy management and building sims or are just into trains this might just be worth the $10 price tag. Almost wish I could've bought it for myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064572919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1511500658}
review: Incredibly entertaining! No matter how well you build your railroad or how many extra trains you add, there is always a more efficient way to do it. Unlimited creativity.  I think many pick this up thinking it will be like a time filler, just something to do, but when you get into campaign, its really much more.  Having trouble woth getting your trains on the track without crashing??? Well, then you can switch to sandbox mode and devise a strategy for the same map.  My youngest son and I have clocked easily 200 hours on this since we bought it 2 years ago, and we still play it.  If you like simulators or love trains and railroads like I do, or even if you dont you will have fun. Highly recommended. Especially if you have kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011129687', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1513198079}
review:
(This is from my blog - Kayas Arcade as a part of my 52 games in 52 weeks challenge)
https://www.facebook.com/Kayasarcade/

Week 39
38/52
Train Valley
Platform: PC
Time: 7 hours
Genre: puzzle, train, simulation

Train valley is a little puzzle game where you build train tracks and you have to make sure that the trains arrive at the right stations... And the trains don't collide. 

The puzzles in Train Valley is rather fun, it's easy to get the head around the whole concept, and you quickly get the idea of how to make sure everything will work out. 

It could be a little more challenging, but I read that the DLC should be more difficult than the main game.

I started playing Train Valley yesterday (after buying the Yogscast jingle jam 2017 humble bundle), and time just fly by. 

I really enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035059251', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1589746517}
review:
This game is a great idea but there are lots of mind-boggling decisions that ruin the game. I will list a couple here:

1. Trains occasionally start without your approval and without warning. It becomes impossible to plan logistics because random events entirely out of your control will cause you to fail the level.
2. As each level progresses, new buildings, stations, bridges, and rail lines are added to the map. This sounds like a good idea because it allows these levels to become incrementally more difficult. Unfortunately, these level additions destroy your existing tracks without warning, often forcing the player to overhaul their track system and causing trains to crash along the way. Again, random events dictate the course of the game rather than planning and strategy.
3. There is no way to save/load your progress on a level, so these random events just waste huge amounts of time. There are some levels that are effectively unbeatable unless you get lucky enough to avoid all of the devastating randomized events. Completing a level and earning the achievements has far more to do with luck than skill.
4. The track addition interface feels slow, clunky, and inaccurate. The creators should have implemented a way to create virtual tracks while paused, and allow the player to modify these tracks free of cost until they are "applied" or the game is unpaused. Instead, any mistakes you make (which are frequent due to the interface) are irreversible without paying large sums of money, ultimately causing you to lose the level or give up achievements.

A game that is built on logistics and planning should not be filled with random events that completely circumvent and nullify your planning attempts, or interface decisions that effectively make planning impossible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022735970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1688844467}
review:
Train Valley, das Zugspiel fÃ¼r Denksportler.
Wer ZÃ¼ge mag, nun ja, der kommt hier auf seine Kosten. Viel wichtiger ist allerdings, dass dieses Spiel die Logistik-Zentrale eures Gehirns anregt. Eine Menge Konzentration wird von euch bei diesem Spiel abverlangt, voallem dann, wenn ihr die sÃ¤mtlichen Bonusziele absolvieren wollt. (Wer hier 100% in allen Leveln schafft sollte es schaffen, eigenhÃ¤ndig die VerspÃ¤tungen der Deutschen Bahn aufgrund von Fehlplanungen zu bereinigen)

Pro:
- Ansprechender Artstyle
- Verschiedenste authentisch dargestellte Gebiete (Europa, Amerika, Asien usw.)
- angemessener Anstieg der Schwierigkeit
- Anspruchvolle Challenges
- Kleiner Preis

Kontra:
- "Freies Spiel" ist verdammt langweilig
- bezÃ¼glich des vorherigen Kontra-Stichpunktes wÃ¼rde ich mir einen Modus wÃ¼nschen mit zufÃ¤lligen Events, welcher aber quasi nie endet
- Man ist recht schnell "durch" mit dem Spiel

PersÃ¶nliches Rating:
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198208078171', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1516925267}
review:
It's definitley a good game. Like, the controls are good (when you increase their size at least so you can see them) and for the most part it all just makes sense.

Simulation is an awkward tag for this game to be honest. The puzzle aspect  is correct. Management should be the biggest tag though. I'm not a fan of the management type games where "time matters." 

But really, it seems good. If you like trains, puzzles and don't mind management, or hell if you're one of those sickos that likes it, then this game is straight up your alley.

Easy to recommend

EDIT: Uh. Difficult should be a fucking tag. This game is hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405283469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1515871625}
review: I didn't get very far. The Idea behind the game seems nice. The controls are nice and easy. I just couldn't figure out why all of a sudden random trains kept popping up that weren't announced before and they kept crashing into my other trains. All the trains usually go bing bing and then you got time to schedule them down a path, but some just go and drive out the station without warning and cause crashes. I don't like how the mechanics work and it makes the game not enjoyable for me. sry.
developer_response:
Hello @Bukanier, thanks for the input! Let me explain how It works little bit. New train appears according to indicator in bottom right corner in vacant station. When all the stations are occupied with trains new train kicks one of them randomly and gets it's place. You can see it as train leaving station without your command. The winning strategy here - to deliver trains in time, and not get overwhelmed with them. You can always use pause - to think little bit and make necessary decisions. 
Hope it helps! Let me know if you have any more questions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971056203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1519248211}
review:
So I picked this up on a whim.  It's got trains and tracks and junctions, but it's not an empire building or micro managing type of game.  Instead, it's a puzzle game done incredibly right!  In essence you design and build your tracks using funds on hand to connect a station or two.  You get notified when a train needs to get from one station to another and the money starts ticking down on that train.  As you progress, more stations are added and more routes need to be created all while trying to prevent trains from running into each other and not going bankrupt.

Truly worthwhile of your cash.  Been my goto game when I want to jump into something quick.  Loads of levels and very replayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044194955', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1640226388}
review: Great game, lots of fun trying to time everything perfectly and plan it all out. Would be nice if there was an endless mode of some kind or alternate sets of tasks for the levels, but this game is well worth the $10 in my opinion. Go download the  free demo if you're thinking about buying, it sold me. 25 hours played in under 3 weeks, a lot of fun. Can't wait for train valley 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035043731', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1515954614}
review:
Das Spiel ist ein gelungener Zeitvertreib. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht allzu hoch aber doch in gewisser Weise fordernd. Alles in Allem ist die Spielzeit nicht allzu lang, wenn man alle Achievements holen will hat man aber doch was zu tun. Manchmal gibt es das Spiel reduziert, dann ist es den Preis in jedem Fall wert. Aber finde auch den vollen Preis gerechtfertigt. 

Ich fand Train Valley sehr entspannend und kurzweilig, daher Daumen hoch.

For me this is a hair pulling kind of game, not quite what i was expecting when i decided to give a go to relax.
But then again thats what you get when you dont read the game discription.

Just need to make sure you properly place your tracks as the tool to do so felt to me a bit clunky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019230275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1515389797}
review:
This game is both fun and challenging. Pausing, selecting trains to start moving and then resuming is great if you want to get the most money. After you beat a level with at least one goal met you can unlock sandbox mode for that level. There's no currency so you can pretty much try out different railway paths. You can be in railway build mode and change track turn direction rather than need to be in track direction control mode.

The only negative is your settings don't save, no matter what. Increase the interface size, sure, but it never stays whatever size you changed it to. This goes for every option. That doesn't mean nothing will change, they do. But once you close the game the settings go back to their default setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066755256', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1542309289}
review:
When you tell people how you spent two hours playing a game about trains, they'll probably react in somewhat the following way:

A) The person that likes strategy games and puzzles:
WOW! I never tought a game about trains could be so enticing! How much is it?

B) The person who likes action games and shooting shit. (Which I perfectly agree on)
Dude, seriously, you gotta get out a little more. We're worried about you.

Depending on what kind of person you are, buy this game!

Overall a pretty good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041887697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1515559376}
review: I like the idea of this game, and it's pretty fun.  But at the fifth level it just starts getting really hard.  I failed because I went "Bankrupt?"  What.  So the game never heard of it's possible to go in the red, get a loan, go on credit, etc etc and then get out of it without going bankrupt?!  It just gets way too challenging and I was just hoping to relax and enjoy a game instead of being frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130731528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1502438462}
review:
Note: Train Valley is a puzzle game. It's like a traffic management game but on rails.

I expected more of a tycoon game, but unfortunately I'm not one for puzzle games. The game looks simple but within a few levels, the game goes up quickly in difficulty, which becomes extremely stressful.

Don't get it if you don't like puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972126139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1612098617}
review:
Great micromanagement game that is easy to learn and isn't filled with clutter or useless stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995734158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1514977099}
review:
I bought this as part of a bundle...I checked out the individual bits and thought "this looks OK", because it reminded me of playing something similar called "Locomotion" on the 8-bit ZX Spectrum 48k.

The music is simple, the graphics are nicely done, but the gameplay is solid.  This is definitely a game that - if you like your puzzles, especially those with a time pressure element to them - you'll enjoy this.  

What starts off simple with just one train and two stations to drive between and make money, rapidly becomes more stations (and more trains), but you can always dial up the risk and earning potential by scheduling more trains, expanding between stations and seeing just how far you can push things with multiple trains on the tracks. 

All the while, the clock ticks along and you see buildings and factories pop up around your stations as you get more money coming in, leading to more valuable cargoes to carry.

The beauty of it is, you don't automatically lose just because you crashed a train (or ten), you can just as easily go bust because you overextended youself by building too much and blew through too much cash.  Therefore, you need to balance your train schedules (earning money) against burning it.

For anyone who ever played with train sets as a kid (esp. Hornby) or still does, you'll most likely love it.  For anyone who wants a good, solid 'build, maintain and expand' sort of game, it gets my vote.  

10/10 makes me want to go back in time to get a job at British Rail and show them how to really run things properly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028266671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1515353155}
review: Sehr schÃ¶nes Puzzle-Spiel fÃ¼r den Gelegenheitszocker. Train Valley ist kein Eisenbahn-Simulator, vielmehr muss man auf unterschiedlichen Karten Schienen verlegen und Weichen stellen, so dass ZÃ¼ge ihren Zielbahnhof erreichen. Pro Level gibt es drei Experten-Ziele die dem Ganzen ein wenig mehr WÃ¼rze verleihen. Die Grafik und Musik passen gut, der Schwierigkeitsgrad schwankt zwischen einfach bis mehr oder weniger herausfordernd. Richtig schwierig wird es leider nie wirklich. Es gibt insgesamt vier "Welten" mit jeweils sechs Leveln. Mit Add-On eine Welt mehr. Die Spielzeit dÃ¼rfte ruhig etwas lÃ¤nger ausfallen denn nach knapp 16 Stunden ist man mit Train Valley durch. Die Errungenschaften erhÃ¶hen den Wiederspielwert nur marginal. Der einzige Kritikpunkt ist die fehlende Undo-Funktion, so mÃ¼ssen falsch gesetzte Schienen direkt wieder abgerissen werden. Im GroÃŸen und Ganzen gefÃ¤llt mir das Spiel sehr gut und ist seinen Preis auf jeden Fall wert. Ich warte gespannt auf Train Valley 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096114971', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1514680735}
review:
The game was pleasant but overall I just did not enjoy it. I do have to commend the developers for including this in a bundle for charity and I felt it was important to try every title just to support. 

I would recommend this game for someone who likes a relaxing puzzler. It never seemed to reach a point where it was stressful. I did not play it very long but the levels I played appeared to have the same music or it just repeated. It gave me the feeling that this game is worth about $5. Not a huge title but certainly a good time waster if you like trains and a relaxing puzzler.

Overall I think the game is good. Game is just not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1514572464}
review:
Train Valley is a railroad simulator where you play as a train operator trying to make trains arrive at their preordained destination. To do so, you lay tracks to connect stations and ensure that trains arrive at the correct location as fast as possible. The faster you get train A to station A, the more money you will make. The game's objective is simply to make coloured trains arrive at the stations of the matching colour to earn money without going bankrupt. Each game year, you will get taxed and lose money. If you crash a train, demolish important structures or send a train too late you will lose money. If you lose all your money, you lose the game. If you finish launching all the trains without going bankrupt, you complete the stage.

Gameplay-wise, it's a mouse click game where you lay tracks, change the direction of the tracks, pause the game, stop a train, reverse the direction of a train and launch trains from stations. It's very important how you lay the tracks as once you lay the track, future tracks may not be able to pass through i.e. tracks can only cross each other at 90 degree angles or join at 45 degrees. There are certain objectives that will increase the difficulty such as not demolishing tracks, not have a train arrive at the wrong station, not stopping a train

Conclusion, do try Train Valley. The puzzles are fun to do and there are some interesting effects like a rocket firing off. You can see the world slowly buildup the more trains you send.

Note : The developers are Alexey Davydov, Sergey Dvoynikov, Timofey Shargorodskiy.

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Train Simulator
That's the main draw of this game. 

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Similar Coloured Train Stations
Light blue, white and teal are so similar that it's hard to tell them apart. The only clear colours are blue, red, yellow, orange, green, purple.

2. Game is Short
Less than 10 hours and everything is over. You would think that for a simple puzzle game, it would be able to generate more interesting stages.

[h1][b]SUGGESTIONS[/b][/h1]
1. More Effects, Please
I want to see even more effects. The best one would be to have a Rube Goldberg styled domino effect with the trains. I'm talking about the rocket lifting off.

2. Pick Up and Deliver
Could you add goods that need to be picked up? Currently, trains just move from station A to station B. How about picking up goods along the way for mission or bonus points? Or pick up and deliver? E.g. Picking up the mail, picking up grain from the grain elevator?

3. Goods
You have to create goods like corn, steel, coal, oil, liquid helium, cars. Depending on what goods the trains are carrying, the crash will be different.

4. Underground Trains
There's no metro map. All your trains are above ground. You need a map that deals with the underground as well. It can't be standalone. You have to make it above ground + under ground.

5. Player Mods
You need to create a workshop so that fans can make their own maps for you and each other. Let the community make maps that they can share and play with/challenge each other.

6. Multiplayer
Imagine the chaos that ensues when your train crashes into my train. ^&$#&$%^$

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1515535038}
review: In this game you essentially make train schedules, but in real time. You need to manage getting trains out on time, making efficient use of track space and junctions, and not go bankrupt. There's also additional challenges for each level, such as "make X amount of profit", "schedule X trains", and so on to make it even more challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055303979', 'num_games_owned': 1731, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1618359929}
review:
â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜† Great

The gameplay revolved around creating an efficient train track system. I enjoyed the gradual progression of difficulty in this game. The levels added different challenges to mix things up. Examples: No pausing the game, no train crashes, no trains at wrong stations... you get the idea, little extra challenges. Also, not even required to beat the levels, just for achievements.

That train sound is just too good. CHOO CHOO!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995922662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1614425259}
review:
Ah man, this game, even though is quite challenging, is such a pleasant and relaxing experience.
It's controls and rules are very simple but the variety of topography of every level makes it quite a diverse experience.
And the soundtrack's great too.

GJ creators, I'm very pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050544998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1526164660}
review: The interface settings could stand to be a bit bigger. The Train scale at the bottom tells you the rate of trains coming out and I never noticed it. This is a fun game that I'd enjoy playing in window mode, but even with the interface all the way up, buttons and words are still microscopic. Other than that the game is pretty challenging and fun. I wish there was more of a timer for when the trains come out automatically with how overwelming the game can get at times. There have been a few times when it chooses to send the train out and I have another tran no less than 1 -2 squares away and there's nothing I can do about that. Pretty frusterating when you're nearing the end of the level with all the awards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062364447', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1515968457}
review: Quite a nice a game, but I found it to be incredibly hard. Not just the challenging hard, but the frustrating hard for anyone that's not a really dedicated perfectionist. For the price tag it's a nice, little puzzle game, but don't expect a relaxing game experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011816621', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1518629771}
review:
Got this in a bundle. I would describe this as a perfectionist's nightmare. You can feel like you have a smart and efficient train network, like you can pwn the game and get the best score. But if you forgot to change one switch you can mess everything up and for me that means restart the level and try again.

Still worth it though. I think the game has a neat idea with quite a lot potential. But damn it made me appreciate automatic signal systems in other games just that much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997255342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1589394955}
review: This is not a railroad game. More like one of those timing games where you have trains randomly show up at some tracks and you have to guide them to a destinatinon. don't get it you're lookng fo more of a railroad tycoon sort of experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198033607599', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1513800635}
review:
It's a good concept, but I wish there was more information about each train. 

Like sometimes I want to dispatch two trains at the same time because it seems like they won't hit each other, but then one train has 4 carts and the other has 1 cart and they end up colliding. 

Also when you don't dispatch a train for a while it will do so automatically and you get no warning apart from a 5 second heads up. 5 seconds isn't enough to plan for it.

To top it all off the depos can sometimes spawn on top of your tracks causing an unexpected crash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409118794', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1598713611}
review:
A brilliant little game. Really simple idea, but really complicated to run when you have lots of stations and trains at the same time. I love it, and my young son loves it too. 

For those complaining about switches randomly changing - it isn't random, it happens when other trains go over them and they aren't pointing the right way to receive the train. They automatically switch so the train can get onto the junction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961412231', 'num_games_owned': 1694, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1574566571}
review: Nothing complicated, but it is challenging and rewarding. Train stations pop up on a map and you have to build tracks and route trains betwene the stations. A simple game that tickes my enjoyment of trains and puzzle solving/logistics. I wouldn't pay a lot for it, but it's worth a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075234627', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1544045436}
review: Boring, all you do is keep track of railroad switches. No fun to be had here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025474029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1673888051}
review: If you like simple little games, then this is not for you, if you want games where 1 little mistake causes you to pull your hair out and still come back for that one more game as know next time, you will do it! then this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059298255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1513507275}
review:
Really fun! I like to play it with the speed on max and pause when I need to think about it. Good time killer train game. Sort of a real time puzzle game, with adjustable speed, and a pause button. Has extra objectives for completionists (3 extra per level). At the end of each "world" there's what seems to be a procedurally generated level you can play endlessly (more on that below).

It's about what you'd expect from the trailer and synopsis, and it's thus far bug free and well polished. I haven't completed it yet, so I may update this later, but here's a list of thoughts about it:

- The "box art" and promotional material show graphics that look stylized, like they're toys or something. This is the style I was expecting, but the game is actually sorta subtle-realism. I feel like they may have started with the cartoony look early in development and switched to the style that exists now, but I wish they had kept the cute toyish style!! 

- Would be cool if you could rotate your camera. You can zoom, and pan, but no rotate. Not a big deal at all, really, but I'm just kind of surprised you can't!

- The procedurally generated levels are very cool, but there are some things I'd love to see changed a little. It's a little bit chaotic. Some trains give you a lot of time before they automatically leave the station, some leave by themselves almost immediately - which makes trains crash a LOT. Also, new train stations can appear in the middle of a track and destroy your track, obstructing a train's path, causing a train crash. And sometimes there are little geysers that appear, which destroy tracks, again causing train crashes. The natural disasters and appearing stations aren't an issue for me, but the randomized train-departing delay is kind of annoying - so if they made it so that trains all start with the same delay before leaving, the rhythm of sending out trains would be more cohesive, and a LOT of fun. In any case though, the procedurally generated levels are a cool addition, especially if you've completed the game and want more!

TLDR:
Well tuned, perfect difficulty, real time train puzzle game, good for decompressing after a long day. 

Keep up the good work, devs!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047729102', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1513190506}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060481565', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1513536948}
review: I love this game! I can't stop playing. It's such a simple concept but the genius is how it all comes together. If you like trains, say goodbye to your life. If you like strategy games or boardgames, say goodbye to your life. If you have $10 to spare, say goodbye to your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970627492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1492753830}
review:
I love this game, and the feel of playing with a train set.

Each level, you will have a new map with stations spawning in semi-random location. You'll have a series of objectives, and will be laying all the tracks in place and then managing the schedules of the multiple trains. The scenarios start out simple, and get much more complex later on. For example, you might have a take of making a certain amount of profit, but later you might have to avoid stopping any trains. If you had the money to build multiple options, you can loop a train out of the way, but when you have many trains moving at once it can be challenging to avoid crashes, send them to the right station, and avoid pausing the game.

Levels are beautiful, and varied, and you have the ability to request additional deliveries if you are feeling brave. 

If you enjoy realtime puzzle games, and playing with trains, this is a gem of a game that I highly recommend at full price. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044771475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1512975866}
review: Difficult but addicting.  Once you get the hang of track placement and pausing when needed / stopping trains you can do good.  Level 1 is easy, level 3 and above start getting nasty, especially if you want achievements.  Overall good puzzle game, I'll probably be buying the DLC after Christmas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029508562', 'num_games_owned': 2560, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1512018460}
review:
It is well presented and has a suitable soundtrack. Despite the lack of complexity, I was obsessed with getting all 3 stamps in all levels for quite a while. It is a game for detail-oriented people who at the same time aren't willing to commit too much time or effort to play a bigger more ambitious game, and that's alright - it's what I was looking for at the time.

You can pause the game while you decide how to spend your credits or how to best develop your tracks. That gives you a better sense of control over how the game plays out and allows you to adjust when something unexpected happens.

If you're looking for a deep game just avoid it, while just go for it if what I said resonates well with what you like in gaming. It is not for everyone, but it works well and shines within its niche.

review: Train Valley is a great sandbox game where you control a train company and you have to delver trains to the correct stations. review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198169957637', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1640554584}
review:
This is a little fun game! There are plenty of [i]different[/i] levels that you can play.  You can buy an expansion to get a couple of extras. However it would be have been nice if the game included just a little more levels, because the ones that there is, is pretty quickly completed. However on the other side it doesn't matter to play the same levels again, espacially if you haven't got all the stamps(optained by completing small missions for each level) for it. But when you have completed the same level five to ten times, it starts to get a little boring.

So instead I would go for the version 2 of this game, which does exist now. It has more features, like being able to make your own levels. This extends the time you will be able to have fun in the game. And for the same price, it is just more valuable than this game.

review:
Mein Gott macht das SpaÃŸ. 

Eher aus Langeweile, billig im Sale geholt hatte ich Ã¼berhaupt keine Erwartungen an dieses Spiel. Es hat mich echt gefangengenommen und erst losgelassen als ich jede Errungenschaft erhalten hatte. 

Im Grunde ist es ein Puzzlespiel. Man legt Gleise um darauf markierte ZÃ¼ge in die richtigen BahnhÃ¶fe fahren zu lassen. Geht dies schnell genug bekommt man viel Geld, geht es langsam wegen anderen ZÃ¼gen oder fehlenden Gleisen / Weichen bekommt man weniger. HÃ¶rt sich simpel an, ist es auch! Aber der SpaÃŸ packt einen unheimlich schnell und ermuntert einen zu: Nur noch ein Level... Auch kann es sehr wusselig werden wenn man zig ZÃ¼ge auf zig Gleisen in Auge behalten muss. Dabei ist Train Valley aber niemals unfair. Alle Anforderungen und Errungenschaften sind fair zu erspielen. 

Absolute Kaufempfehlung fÃ¼r ein Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch und fÃ¼r 10 â€“ 20 Stunden SpielspaÃŸ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198204159008', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1510345997}
review:
A familiy friendly game to play occasionally with nice animations and even with the try of expansion, i.e. the Germany DLC. For sure it's within its limits. Long time ago, there was a game called "Locomotion". Train valley picks up the basic idea behind it, transfering trains from station A to station B avoiding collisions. It's, of course, level-up compared to Locomotion, the player can 
- Build track,
- Remove track,
- Start trains,
- Halt trains,
all the things he/she couldn`t do in Locomotion. And although there still seems to be the common factor that the player has to change switches in order to direct trains correctly, it's not really the case, because in Train Valley, switches can be set back automatically according to trains to possibly let them pass.
For more additional material, the player is invited to consult the DLC, Super Train will appear and bombs will fall and destroy parts of the track. The level of challenge can be adjusted by three time configurations (1x, 2x, 4x) as one might tend to like it. Future games can be build on this idea and the genre further improved, may be a reasonable conclusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205215707', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1544166333}
review:
Train valley certainly one of the best games I have ever played.

"Its just trains." Cry my friends when I rave about it, they are wrong. If you think along their lines, think again.

Firstly a warning, this is a puzzle game. If you love trains but despise puzzle games I would not recommend you to pick it up. However, to all of you still left, if you like puzzles or even have a passing intrest in them I would highly recommend this to you. You do not need to know the first thing about trains. All I know is what I learnt from a childhood addiction to Thomas the tank engine.

The gameplay for the whole time is exhilarating. You are tasked at directing the trains which pop up at various stations, building tracks to new stations and while doing all this trying to keep above that dreaded Â£0. This may not sound like much but it will keep you invested for many hours. This is beacuse this game is tuned to perfection. You start off with some money to build your initial track and you start to build up some income, however just as you start to feel comfortable the intensity is ramped up by the addition of another station. This ruins even the best layed plans and forces you to think on your feat. The intesity is layered up until you finally finish a level and can finally breath a sigh of releif after an exhilarating time.

Furthermore this game sets the difficulty just right. It never feels too easy or too hard. As I progressed through the game I found myself getting better and better, but the game was improving at the same pace. The game never felt as if it was throwing an impossible challenge at you, on the other hand it never felt it was just gifting you a free pass as I progressed throught the game. However, this style of design heavily impacted one important feature of any video game... Replayability. After I got through the game I replayed some of the earlier levels doing some achievement hunting, they were so easy. After you get all the stamps and the achievements you can't go back and retry the earlier levels as you will be able to play them at mostly 4X speed.

The DLC is also a very welcome addition, I bought the game without the DLC but when I finished the game I immediately bought it. It adds extra play time to the game, extra challenge and many new innovative features. Most importantly it doesn't feel like something the devs took out of the main game just to squeeze every last pound out of us, it adds many new innovative design features not present in the main game.

In conclusion this game is a M A S T A P E E C E and you should buy it. It is only Â£6.99 and while I got it on a deal I would happily buy it again at full price. I have had a great time with this game and I am looking forward to experiencing the joy of it all over again with train valley 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043904467', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1510984069}
review: There is something about this game that really can't be described. Your first 30 minutes are wondering how this is even a game...it seems so simple and almost boring. An hour in you're starting to get the hang of it, but your trains are still crashing and missing their targets...15 hours in and you're a masterful director of trains, having 4, 5, or 6 long trains all active at once going towards their destinations and furiously clicking the lane switchers to make sure you get everyone to their objective without a mistake. Absolutely and incredibly fun.

review: Despite running into a bug which deleted my saved games on Linux Mint, this game is SO FUN. I can highly recommend it. It's a simple game of managing that trains get to their designated stations. The graphics are fine, the music is cute and surprisingly good and the gameplay can be challenging, in terms of actually managing multiple trains at once. It's a fun little game I must say. I didn't expect to play with trains, honestly. I really didn't. But this game is so straightforward, lightweight and innocent that I can only recommend it :).
