author: {'steamid': '76561197977105828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1488229977}
review:
What is Train Valley?

Genre: Top-Down Train Track Puzzle & Strategy
Setting: Establishing and improving railroad lines in different countries, completing special tasks along the way
Difficulty: 3/10 - 7/10 - depends on the selected scenario chapter
Length: 5-10 hours for a campaign walkthrough
Mode: singleplayer only
Similar games: can't name any, sorry


What's good about train valley?

- unique chapters with different artworks (e.g. Russia, Japan, Germany, USA)
- additional special tasks ("challenges") to always keep on improving the railroad network
- easy to get into 
- some levels contain unique specifications you have to deal with
- more simultaneously running, longer and faster trains make up a challenge for your mind!


The negative aspects:

- balancing issues. While one mission can be easy, the next can get surprisingly tough
- trains and stations can't be chosen, they are prespecified by the game (to be fair, that's part of the game mechanics, too)
- the game's music is horrible, and pretty clichÃ© (especially the German tracks)




Result (and summary for those who have no time reading):

Train Valley is a nice puzzling game, using trains as a theme. Depending on your mind skills (hopefully you got some), you will have a challenging or overcharging time fulfilling the missions and special tasks. In general, decent and colourful graphics, varying and motivating special tasks and missions sum up to present the game in a nice and friendly atmosphere. However, the soundtrack is horrible, better turn on your music library while playing - if your mind skills allow you to listen to music and concentrate on the game at the same time.

Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068824513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1493494847}
review:
This is a great game.  This is an efficiency game that is both fun and frustrating at the same time.

Unfortunately, It only took 10 hours to beat.  I'll be getting more levels if they release a DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1480295425}
review:
A puzzle game that involves moving trains from one station to the other. You have to match the correct place they go, or you will either crash the train or fail. You also need to place the correct rails at certain places to make sure the train goes where it is supposed to go. It does involve some strategy.

The game is quite unforgiving to newer players as the tutorial is not very helpful. It does try to help a bit, but the game is very difficult after certain levels.

If you like puzzles, then you can enjoy this game. If you like trains, this game will be even more fun for you.

Recommended for a fun puzzle game. It is also fine for young children to play this game, as it can be used as a teaching tool for strategy and movement and puzzle placement. I also found the puzzle aspect of it very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025048256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1705386998}
review: Solid efficiency game.  Got into it when I tried to beat every objective per level.  At first I wasn't too thrilled but now I just bought the German levels and intend on beating it all the way through.  I wish they had a special stamp for beating all the objective at once though. Great game, worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996763361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1493442225}
review: This game seems like a fun little puzzler, but it has no depth at all. The first couple of levels are fun but that is all there is as all following levels are just more of the same in every aspect. The objectives are uninspired and repeat themselves every other level. There isn't any progression at all, every level you just lay more tracks in a slightly different layout without any new obstacles or gameplay elements added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068669778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5716, 'last_played': 1493497393}
review: I love the graphics, it's really neat and the childish-realistic balance of it just works perfect for me. I like cute games, this is one of them. Not very challenging if you only go for passing the levels withouts completing the extra goals but it can be rather difficult if you want to complete every chapter with 3 starts (or in this case: stamps). Train Valley is super simple and quick to learn which is a huge plus for a mother of 3 devils with no time to waste. This game is a lovely little brain massage, nice and relaxing. I barely cursed - maybe 3 or 4 times - during the 85hours it took to play through every level (probably I would have been able to do it in 40 hours if my 3 years old has had not insisted on sitting on my lap and assisting me with the mouse coordination.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968878288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1519736963}
review:
I love this game! I just finished playing it as well as the Germany DLC and I'm gutted there's no more till the sequel in 2018! I love these kinds of puzzle games, this one only has a few minor issues:
- Bankruptcy happens really suddenly and is too harsh - it should at least give you a few seconds to get back into the black.
- You don't know where stations are going to spawn ahead of time.
- The objectives could be a bit more interesting.

But overall I had loads of fun playing this and I'm now looking for other similar games... Well done devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116541741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1493247746}
review:
Looks nice, plays nice - for a while. CONGRATULATIONS - you are among a group of programs I can count on one hand that managed to hard-crash Windows 10. I am SO freaking glad I waited until this was on sale for less than $3 to buy.  

Now say it with me: "I will never write a program loop that can potentially loop infinitely without allowing indows events to process!" Yup - thats all you have to do - in any loop which could get stuck because you assume that an exit condition Will occur, put in a call to Application.DoEvents - it doesnt have to be in Every iteration of the loop - you could always add a counter or check system time and check the milliseconds MOD some value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127596898', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1454217338}
review:
My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me, "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

This was a prank, but I really don't like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284357725', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1705240586}
review:
Train Valley est un simulateur de gestion de lignes ferroviaires, un peu comme Mini-Metro ou vous devez dessiner simplement les lignes de chemins de fers entre les diffÃ©rentes gares ainsi que la circulation des trains. Il va aussi falloir faire attention au budget car construire des lignes coÃ»te cher, et on gagne de l'argent en faisant arriver les trains Ã  la bonne gare. 

CÃ´tÃ© graphisme, le jeu est trÃ¨s joli et nous fais voyager dans l'histoire ferroviaire, on dÃ©marre en Europe, on voyage en AmÃ©rique et on finit dans un univers plus futuriste au Japon.  Le jeu est facile Ã  prendre en main, notamment grÃ¢ce Ã  un systÃ¨me de couleur bien pensÃ©. 

Mais il ne faut pas se fier Ã  l'aspect trÃ¨s joli du titre puisque le jeu est plutÃ´t difficile. En plus de finir le niveau, il faudra pour recueillir les collectables, finir le niveau avec certaines conditions, ce qui rallonge la durÃ©e du titre. Un plus non nÃ©gligeable est l'aspect bac-Ã -sable qui permet de se laisser aller. 

Un trÃ¨s bon jeu de gestion, original avec une difficultÃ© croissante et une bonne durÃ©e de vie. Si vous voulez en savoir un peu plus, n'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  lire mon article sur le sujet : [url=https://laplumedelamesange.wordpress.com/2017/02/23/train-valley-ou-la-gestion-des-lignes-ferroviaires-a-travers-les-ages/] Train Valley ou la gestion des lignes ferroviaires Ã  travers les Ã¢ges [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026311016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1563641796}
review:
This is a neat little game! Many train games are focused on the driving, speed, and so on. The game here is more equivalent to a model train set, wherein your responsibility is designing the layout of the railroad network and dispatching trains to their appropriate destinations. I've played through about 12 levels so far and many have posed a great challenge for me! But there is not a moment that I am not having fun. The background music can quickly get a bit repetitive, so I would recommend turning that off after a little while. Once I completely play through the game, I plan to go back again and ensure I pass all of the levels _with_ the bonus objectives.

All in all this is a great game. It requires careful planning, precision execution, and a computer with only decent spects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052753858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1517164268}
review: I was on the fence when i was thinking about purchasing this game as it doesn't seem like the typical game i would buy. However after reading the reviews on this game , i decided to purchase it..... Well , all i can say is what a game :). I absolutely love it..... it is exactly like building a train set only with challenges along the way... if you like a fun but challenging game whilst relaxing at the same time and you like trains then this is the game for you. Also the soudtrack reminds me of a classic game of 'Lemmings' :D..... I will also be purchasing 'Train Valley 2' when it gets released.... Well done Devs on a game well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119696946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1747, 'last_played': 1493990134}
review:
The demo managed to hold my attention for more than 30 minutes which was enough to convince me to plonk down some dosh to get the full game. Great little puzzler and like others have mentioned, it did remind me of Flight Control but with trains. Well worth considering, especially when on sale.

Note: I did originally plan on playing this on a touch screen enabled device, and while it did work mostly, I found that having a nice gaming mouse enhanced the experience that much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969722720', 'num_games_owned': 1094, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1491822759}
review:
Train Valley might look like a 'casual' game, but it's far from easy, and approaching it as a loose, casual game will only bring you grief! You need to make friends with the 3-step speed controls and the Pause button in order to succeed. That's because although laying your track is half the battle, the funds to build and destroy it come from the deliveries you make, and crashes and wrong destinations all impact your income. In other words, the main fight here is with scheduling your trains. 

The game mechanics are fairly intuitive, and of course the more you play, the more you understand. In this way, Train Valley is both rewarding and frustrating, because there are still some things that require some time and attention to understand. One key concept here, which I'm still not entirely sure about really, is of your trains taking off of their own accord once the cargo value timer has dropped to a certain point. This appears as a set of tiny figures above each train, and if I have only one complaint with the game, it's that this essential bit of information is too small to see comfortably. There is a handy option to scale the UI up and down, although the figures don't scale with it.

The feedback between your tack layouts and the efficiency of your scheduling is pretty tight -- get one right, and the other will work so much the better too. With successive timely deliveries made, your cash reserves will be able to cope with the odd crash or mis-direction. In the end though, it's easy to over-spend, so walking that tightrope between track design and scheduling is, again, crucial.

As much as Train valley is about quickly clicking on your junctions and switches, the game definitely gives your brain a good workout, in much the same way that Bridge Constructor-type games do. I think it's well worth the 10 Euro Steam price, although I got mine for 2 Euros from Bundlestars, which is an absolute steal, frankly. Great game, and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007316954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1606994419}
review: A great puzzle game that can easily lead to you spending an entire afternoon playing. The premise is simple, guide trains to the station of the same color by switching track junctions to the direction they want to travel. But it quickly becomes more hectic as you have mulitple trains to the same station, new stations opening up that need you to lay new track to and if that wasnt enough there are three optional objectrives for each level. A great game at a great price!

review:
How can someone not recommend this game!
If you ever wanted to know what it is like having your own trainset at home but spending all that cash held you back? 
Than this is your game.

It is a addicting management game
and when all your trains are moving on that perfectly thought out track.
You feel like a boss.
However when things turn into chaos, you will give curse yourself.

There aren't really any negatives besides one annoyance which is the difficulty of drawing the tracks. Sometimes it is hard to guide them where you want them to go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999889274', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1645764521}
review: One of the simplest games and yet one of the most both enjoyable and frustrating at the same time.  It was recommended by a friend 2 days ago and I haven't stopped playing since.  Build a track, set the track direction and let the train run.  That's it.  That is, until you have trains going everywhere all at the same time, then it gets pretty frantic.  Great game, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081245180', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1629526063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052389780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1594738115}
review:
I have been having a blast with this puzzle game. Mostly because I found out there is a pause game button, so I can plan my moves without rushing everything.

The game has been very stable, no crashes. Some people have complained about the collision not working correctly, but I suspect that is a problem with their computer, or they are not paying close attention to their trains movement, because I am on the 3rd level and have had no such problems. I have crashed trains, but that was my fault, not the games.

The game is very replayable, as each level starts with different train stations at the start. And its also random which station trains will start at. Like most puzzle games, you can replay levels as much as you like, to better your score or just for the fun of it.

Overall, I recommend the game to anyone who likes puzzle type games. If you like it fast paced, then don't use the pause key. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996122610', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1517701385}
review: Great little game. It can be an incredibly frustration game at times because it gets challenging when you have a lot of stations, trains and switches to look after. This is by no means a bad thing. I've quite enjoyed the challenge. If you're a fan of trains and puzzles then this is definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973387047', 'num_games_owned': 2924, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5107, 'last_played': 1501744257}
review:
I enjoy "Train Valley" very much!  Looks good.  Plays good.  And is quite challenging!
I even took the time to complete all of the levels in the main game all with three stamps.
Highly recommend!

Have also purchased and played most of the "Germany" DLC.
The DLC is quite a bit more difficult and buggy.  The DLC has frozen up on me numerous times.
The "Germany" DLC felt rushed compared to the main game.
Would only recommend the "Germany" DLC if you loved the main game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003053483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2960, 'last_played': 1654631247}
review:
This is a great mini-game providing lots of fun for at least 20 hours. New price is â‚¬9,99 so this is great value, also. Your goal is to send all trains to their specific station. Don't make a mess crashing them or sending them to the wrong station. Different level with different tasks, so your gameplay changes every level. Not too hard to get all medals. 

The biggest plus for me: I didn't found a single bug, well coded piece of software (or app, as you freaky young people would call it)!

Very good gameplay, neat graphics, all you need. And you don't even need to be a train maniac to love this game. Grab it!

review: This game is like Trainyard on Apple's Appstore.  Cool to play, good user interface.  Nice graphics.  You can easily enjoy 20 hours and more of gameplay with this game.  Would be good to be able to upgrade track points to automatic in a sandbox mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012902673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1485390647}
review: Train Valley is a Mini Metro-esque puzzle game disguised as a railroad management game. You have to manage money and all that, but it's really about plotting out your railroads, switching the junctions, and managing the trains all moving at once. It makes for some really challenging puzzles, and the cute aesthetic brings it together nicely. It does take a while to figure out that streets have no real impact on gameplay, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982658491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1495400711}
review:
This is actually a surprisingly-charming little real time strategy/puzzle game.

Nicely paced, you can pause and plan at any time, but you have to keep to juggle a lot of variables in your head at once. Planning out an order of operations for the trains is an evolving challenge, since you can request virtually as many trains to manage as you want -- a lovely self-balancing system.
The objectives are all optional, and so the game easily scales in difficulty. Grade school children and adults alike can play the game and progress through the maps while feeling challenged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027103160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1484915748}
review: Solid puzzler, mechanics are simple to grasp, hard to master, fun, and frustrating. You'll swear the computer is switching tracks on you when you're not looking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960381245', 'num_games_owned': 2092, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1694083597}
review: This game is a fun, relaxing, joyful little timewaster. Building and rerouting tracks, sending trains on their way feels like a wonderfully purified of heavyweights like Railroad Tycoon. Distilled down to a simple core mechanic, that is just fun in it's own way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028441712', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1485673956}
review:
[h1]86 / 100[/h1]

Looking at [b]Train Valley's (TV)[/b] store page a while back, I overlooked this game as a basic train simulator, when in fact it plays more of a puzzle game with some real-time strategy elements thrown in! [b]TV[/b] uses some fairly simple but effective rules. Lay a track between stations, and deliver as many trains without incident, as quickly as possible. You can choose where to lay the track, purchased from the earnings you get from train deliveries, and trigger when the trains depart. These are colour coded to let you know where to send the train. You can also rush trains by purchasing them for bonus score & turn trains around or stop them.  Your money is always going down so the pressure is on!

Where tracks overlap, you have get a switchboard, that you can reposition between your alternative track paths. On complex track layouts, this can be quite challenging to keep every train going where they should especially when you start to juggle multiple trains enroute at a single time. Good planning is a must!

Puzzle mechanics are easy, but increase exponentially as paths multiply. As you progress through the 20 scenarios [i](+5 more in the DLC)[/i] across 4 seasons, the difficulty is increased by putting more obstacles in your way, increasing the frequency of the trains & also other level specific challenges. Each level has 3 bonus goals to achieve as well, which can be done on multiple playthroughs. When things get too hectic, you can pause the timer giving you a moment to regroup. Although the maps are small, there is ample variety in the challenges presented, they are thoughfully designed, balanced & do not become stale.

Sound design is good, providing clear audio feedback to the actions occurring on screen, but these can get repetitive [i](especially the ding of the train leaving for me)[/i]. Levels are clear to navigate and laying track is generally an easy task. Occasionally, you can lay a track as your mouse moves slightly to the adjacent square, causing issues laying things the wrong way. It would be good to be able to demolish for the same cost if the timer hasn't been resumed to recover costs [i](as income is limited)[/i].

Likewise, the financial impact of two trains colliding plus the many squares of track loss often spells doom & essentially the end for your level. It seems a bit excessive at times, and can frustrate, as can that random train departure who has just got in the way of everything! Thankfully, most levels are pretty quick to balance this out to a degree.

Despite these stress points, it has been hard to drag myself away from [b]TV[/b] for very long. Still trying to beat some of the later levels in the German DLC. It is highly addictive once you get a few levels in and will continue to challenge your time management & coordination skills all the way to the last level.


[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857016/]If you enjoyed reading this review, please follow [u]True Blue Reviews[/u] for more recommendations![/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1484254875}
review:
I really tried hard to like this game. I played the game once and didn't like it. A few months later I decided to give it another try because I really like train games. I've put hundreds of hours into Railroad Tycoon, Avalon Hills 1830 and many other train games.

Unfortunately Train Valley is one of the few train games I don't like. To be honest, it is terrible. The on screen instructions are confusing - for example the first pop up tells you to create a track by joining green tiles. What green tiles - oops, the forget to tell you to first click the tiny track construction icon.

Similarly I never managed to meet some goals because I had no idea how to do what the game asked. Dispatch 3 additional trains - I assume I click on the dispatch train icon, but nothing happens. At some point I do manage to dispatch a train but I have no idea how and I can't dispatch the required 3 trains.

None of this would matter much if the game were fun, but it isn't. Sending trains out of stations and switching track, how exciting. Boring and confusing sums up this game, worst train game I've played in ages, maybe ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977129078', 'num_games_owned': 1695, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1484203807}
review: Game not optimized for higher resolutions, so you either have tiny little buttons, or play at a much lower resolution. Mouse controls are bit wonky, the detection of where it thinks the cursor is moving can be erratic. Track switching game mechanic isn't optimized very well. While the core of the game is a fine idea, it didn't hold my attention very long. Mini Metro is WAY more fun, more challenging, and more addicting, I recommend that instead

author: {'steamid': '76561198048841405', 'num_games_owned': 1451, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1630864332}
review: Great little game. It's MiniMetro crossed with Airport Madness. Lay track to create routes between stations, dispatch and route trains and try not to let anything hit each other. Simple but fun. Great and enjoyable way to relax and pass time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982800962', 'num_games_owned': 2601, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1482444647}
review: A train management game that your job is to send trains that spawn from certain color stations to other color stations by building the track for the trains to get to the stations. Things get pretty hectic as more stations pop up while managing the other trains. From the technical side I had no issues with it and it ran fine.  Really had a good time playing it and the art and scenery I thought was nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971905409', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1493831764}
review:
If you're even vaguely interested in puzzle games, then holy poop, this is an absolute gem! The mechanics are so simple and easy to learn, but once you're a couple of levels in you'll realise how complicated this game can get. Even failure feels great, as soon as you realise your mistake you'll wanna get straight back in and get it right.

BUY BUY BUY IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981864933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1483739595}
review:
A Strangly Addictive Game

I bought this game looking for something like the old-schoold game Atrain (DOS) and when I first launched it, I was disapointed as it wasn't like that. But that's okay as it never was promised as such and I didn't read the description before purchasing it. With the amount of positive reviews it has, it was a sure buy - and it has trains.

I was instantly hooked on the game once I got the overall concept and how the game worked. It's a game like none other I have played despite having the same concepts as others. But it is unique in the method of which everything is applied.

Train Valley is a simple game as-is, but that doesn't make it easy. It can be a very challenging game and you'll spend a lot of time getting those last few stamps. With a relative small map, you have to build train tracks between given stations and change the tracks to direct your trains towards the proper station. That in itself would be easy if you had unlimited money, time, and space - but you don't - and that's where the challenge lies.

It would have been nice with a few more levels and maybe a few bigger ones, but for a sales price it's more than enough content and you can have hundreds of hours entertainment for very little money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001458254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1644521186}
review:
Was ist Train Valley?
Genau das wonach es aussieht: Das Spielen mit ModellzÃ¼gen in einem vorgegebenen Level.
Dabei verlegt man Schienen und stellt stÃ¤ndig an Weichen um mÃ¶glichst viele ZÃ¼ge pro Zeit von A nach B zu bringen.
Jedes Level hat eine Zeitbegrenzung, fÃ¼r jedes zusÃ¤tzlich erreichte Ziel (keine UnfÃ¤lle, SchienenÃ¤nderungen, Falschfahrten, ...) gibt es Bonusstempel.
Aber manche Level sind schon von Haus aus zum Haare ausraufen schwer (6 Stationen getrennt von einem Fluss mit 1 BrÃ¼cke darÃ¼ber). Und es sind nicht nur die Level, mit der Zeit kommen unterschiedlich schnelle/lange ZÃ¼ge etc. dazu.
Dabei muss man stÃ¤ndig finanziell Ã¼ber Wasser bleiben und mit mÃ¶glichst zeitnah absolvierten Fahrten genug Geld fÃ¼r neue Schienen zusammen zu bekommen.
Jedes Level ist zwar beim Wiederholen grundlegend gleich, allerdings variiert die Reihenfolge spanender Stationen und Fahrten.
Nach spÃ¤testens 20 min ist man im Bau- und Weichenstell-Fieber um endlich die 3 Sterne am gegenwÃ¤rtigen Level zu schaffen.
Die Herausforderungen sind dabei abwechslungsreich, sinnvoll, herausfordernd aber fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035050953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2423, 'last_played': 1693150254}
review:
+ Clean interface
+ Good concept
+ Casual Gaming possible because of "Pause"-Button
+ Trains with different speeds and length
+ Challenging Levels with 3 Goals that can be reach single or combined
+ Colorblinde Mode (developer helped me with this info)

- Trains running over switches change the switch to driving direction of the train
- Sandbox mode is nice but a Level Editor and sharing Levels over Workshop would have been great
- I like playing in Windowed-Mode but wenn I miss the Pause Button and hit the Window X the Game is just quits (I know I could use the Keyboard to Pause but I like to use the mouse)
Hitting the X with other games in windows mode often just pauses them or brings up an options menu

author: {'steamid': '76561197996791819', 'num_games_owned': 6943, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3711, 'last_played': 1627833116}
review:
I love this game.
I didn't know what to expect when I started it (got it with Humble montlhy) then spent several hours playing it, got most of the achievements and bought the DLC.

Not sure if there will be more DLC but I'm ready to buy it if there will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015038017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1485247484}
review: Train Valley met my expectations.  I find the videos and screenshots to be misleading, as they feature zoomed in views of the map.  I play zoomed all the way out so I can always see the entire map.  I don't see any advantage to zooming in.  Each level starts with two or three stations.  You decide where the track goes.  Trains appear at random stations, and you need guide each train to its desired destination.  As the level progresses, more stations appear.  You have much more control than in Mini Metro, and consequently you do more micromanagement - mostly toggling switches to try to route trains where you want them to go.  On the plus side, this means that when things go wrong, it is almost always your fault, whereas success in Mini Metro depends more on luck and chance.  More trains + more track + more switches = more complexity.  You can also call in extra trains for extra points.  The challenge is designing and discovering track layouts that are easy to manage.  Some of the UI elements could be improved (see my comment in the Steam discussions), but I have adapted to the unfortunate UI deficiencies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006794286', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1642247127}
review:
Train Valley is a great little game, if you just want a nice end to a day, and do something, just to unwind alittle, then i can wholeheartedly reccomend this game for you. 
It has:
1 Trains
2 Puzzles
3 Cool Music (which my wife says is very relaxing so im allowed to keep the sound on)
4 Extra depth (you lose if you go bankrupt - so its not just moving trains)
5 Nice Gfx.
6 Trains

all in all 10/10 for effort, looking forward to train valley 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079533645', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1507094370}
review:
I was at first sceptic when I bought this game but after seeing the menu screen alone I was hooked. I would easily drop $7000 on this masterpiece instead of Train Simulator 2017.

10/10 This game is the only reason I'm still alive

author: {'steamid': '76561198040080240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1482830244}
review: Awesome puzzle game. The objective is very clear but challenging to reach sometimes, exactly as it should be. Getting through the levels can be easy or mighty difficult if you go for perfect performance in one go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1482657383}
review: Going into it, having only looked at the title and a few screenshots I expected a watered-down version of Railroad Tycoon, but still an economic strategy. Instead I got an arcade game where the core of the gameplay is laying tracks and operating junctions so that nothing crashes. But I'm far from disappointed. There is something incredibly satisfying about playing with trains and operating the switches, listening to all the choo-choos and occasional explosion. It seems the game successfully evoked subconscious, positive feelings of playing with model trains when I was younger. Which almost guaranteed that I love it, unless there would've been some hiccup with the technical particulars (ex. graphics, sound). Luckily those are also spot on and while not very impressive or flashy, they keep in theme with the playful atmosphere. The only issue is a nasty crash when closing the game, but there are workarounds (alt-f4 followed by ctrl-alt-del). Highly addictive and recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007441072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1511434270}
review: This is a very fun and interesting puzzle game. It can get hard at times (looking at you Germany level 2). The Challenge Stamps are there to make the game a little harder and a little more interesting, but you don't have to get all the Challenge Stamps in one run to get them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045647569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1541711431}
review:
Very nice game puzzle/strategy game. Took me about 10 hours to finish with all the stamps.

Pros: addictive, nicely done, soundtrack is very good.
Cons: some features would be nice to have, like planning tracks before paying for them as it's not possible to put tracks anywhere in any arrangement. It would also be nice to know the speed of the pending trains to be able to plan for possible collisions.

review: Train Valley is a simple but solid game. That gives you a good amount of fun and hours to play. It's nothing really special, but has his moments where your taciticel knowledge and engineerity is needet. I had a lot of fun playing it, but now that I finished all levels (plus DLC) and got al achivments the game has come to an end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088007517', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1484178965}
review:
This gameâ€™s Steam description doesn't make it justice. Many people, including me, bought Train Valley expecting something on the vibes of Railroad Tycoon, which it isn't.

Although, Train Valley is a very nice and challenging puzzle game. You must plan your tracks ahead, monitor your switches, everything to make every train arrive to their destinations in time, preventing collisions on the way.

It's simple and easy to learn, but demands rapid thinking and decision-making at later levels. I do recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971468531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1704741527}
review:
The perfect little time killer. You can jump on for 10/15 mins or find yourself an hour later still glued to this. To call it a spinning plates game would do it a disservice.

Gameplay involves deciding where and how to lay tracks then managing the track switching to make sure the trains go to the correct destinations. Itâ€™s all about laying efficient routes (financially and practically) and juggling the train journeys between points. You're under a time limit - the longer the trains take, the less money you earn. You have a finite amount of money to lay tracks. Destroying buildings/trees to lay tracks costs more. These time and money pressures add up to make a well balanced challenging little game.

A simple premise, it's addictive and moreish. This is more puzzle game than train sim..shame it's not on mobile.

Kudos to the devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198192883790', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1665878518}
review:
Puzzle game on when to start/stop trains to make the most money and accomplish the goals without crashes. You get to build some tracks and destroy some scenery but it is a brain teaser puzzle game first and foremost. Design your tracks with loops to allow you to pass trains past each other and create intricate switches to complete tasks. It is a fun addictive game that doesn't always require alot of time to just relax with.

Not a resource simulation but still very fun with cool environments and visuals for a puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051892158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1514229522}
review:
So addictively fun to play.

Deceptively simple, just the right amount of difficulty to keep you retrying failed objectives, over and over again. :)

This game's not without side effects though. I found myself dusting off boxes looking for my 80's N gauge train set?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030048030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1696863135}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007033314', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1481314575}
review:
I'm not a huge puzzle game fan and I was hoping for a bit more Railroad Tycoon style depth but there is no disapointment here, its really addicting.

This has more in common with Mini Metro than it does Railroad Tycoon but where Mini Metro is savagely unforgiving this much easier to learn and adapt to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136439185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1450997202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072145638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5672, 'last_played': 1638592350}
review:
First, and most importantly-- This is a puzzle game revolving around managing increasingly complex train lines and switches. This is NOT a railroad tycoon game. Mini Metro would be a closer analogy, though the two games are quite different.

It starts off simply as you route slow moving trains between a small number of stations. The difficulty ramps up considerably with an increase in train speeds/types, station quanities, difficult terrain, and challenging secondary objectives. (IE, Don't allow trains to arrive at the wrong station, no pausing, Dispatch X additional trains, etc...) 

Highly recommended for train and/or puzzle fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286017559', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1480617929}
review:
Looking at it, you may think it's just a casual sim made for kids, with it's innocent looking graphics and fun style of art. You're mistaken that's what, it's a gut wrenching game that's absolutely terrifying with how hard it is, no matter how long you'll manage to keep the train going, your brain is going to die and you'll ess everything up I promise.



But it's pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080665452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1647054479}
review:
Bei "Train Valley" geht es darum, die eigenen Strecken und Wege zu optimieren, neue Ziele auf der Karte anzufahren und die ZÃ¼ge heil und sicher an den Endbahnhof zu bringen. Dabei nimmt die Kniffligkeit der einzelnen Level zu und auch die Herausforderungen werden schwieriger zu erfÃ¼llen.
Das Spiel ist fÃ¼r all die geeignet, die Puzzlespiele mÃ¶gen. Das Streckenbauen in Knuffeloptik ist zwar im Eisenbahnsetting, aber die Mechanik ist ganz klar keine Fahrplansimulation. 

Die Umsetzung ist schÃ¶n, die BahnhÃ¶fe werden selbstÃ¤ndig ausgebaut, manchmal tut sich auch anderes auf der Karte. Auch der Rest ist toll aufgemacht. In einem Briefmarkenalbum sammelt man Stempel (also Auszeichnungen), die LÃ¤nder auf den Marken stehen fÃ¼r die Levels und passen definitiv zur Zielgruppe. NatÃ¼rlich ist das keine High-End-Graphik, aber wer braucht das schon fÃ¼r so ein Spiel.

Wer gerne Strecken baut, das Zugsetting mag und grunsÃ¤tzlich Puzzlespiele auch, der bekommt ein schÃ¶nes familientaugliches Spiel mit steigendem Kniffelfaktor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972597927', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1476876954}
review:
La verdad es que no esperaba mucho de este juego ya que es un indie sobre el que no hay mucha informaciÃ³n en espaÃ±ol.Realmente lo comprÃ© porque me gustan mucho los trenes.

Pues bien,es un seÃ±or juegazo.Realmente el juego encaja muy bien con el famosa frase "fÃ¡cil de jugar ,dÃ­ficil de dominar" 

Por un lado tienes que construir las vÃ­as y los cambios de agujas de la manera mÃ¡s eficiente posible y por otro,debes estar muy atento para dar la orden de salida a los trenes en el momento adecuado para que no choquen.

No es un juego de gestiÃ³n econÃ³mica ya que solo debes tener cuidado de no arruinarte, es mÃ¡s bien un juego de planificaciÃ³n rÃ¡pida y destreza mental.

Por cierto,los grÃ¡ficos son muy vistosos y la mÃºsica es muy pegadiza.

review: It's pretty fun building tangles of track and then trying to direct multiple trains through it at once. There's not much depth to it though. It would have been nice to have more options. It only took 2 or 3 days to get through all the levels. Pleasant music and good sound effects.

review: This is a fun game with a simple concept. Make sure all the trains get to the station they need too, sounds easy enough. It starts off that way, but quickly becomes much more difficult and you can lose track of trains fairly easily. It is a fun and easy game to pick up and if you don't have much time you can pick it up and attempt a level they usually are not too long, but sometimes it can be easy to fail.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960270054', 'num_games_owned': 2270, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1479955642}
review:
Train Valley nails the simple game mechanics + good execution = fun gameplay formula. There isn't much to Train Valley, you can build tracks, start or stop trains, and toggle switches between tracks. The real fun in the game lies in trying to reach the level goals and achievements. Complete the level without ever stopping a train or maximize your efficiency to make as much money as possible. It has a lot of parallels with tower defense games. You want to build you train tracks in an efficient layout, connecting all your stations in all directions, but using the minimum amonut of space. You only want to spend money on new track when you have to, using surplus cash to send extra trains for even more money.

Overall a solid recommendation. Especially if you enjoy the mazing and profit min/maxing parts of tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002401740', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1612243913}
review:
Wow. It's a lot of puzzle, planning out routes, getting timings down, and thinking that your routes look pretty nice when - oh god, these 2 stations don't connect to each other, quickly let's fix it before - curses, I forgot to move the switch and now this other train is moving in the wrong direction.

Overall, it's a pretty good game. I just played 4 levels and already I can feel the difficulty rising, but not so much that I want to throw out this game. And when you've had enough of the train madness, you can do sandbox mode, where you go to that map you love and hate so much and build tracks everywhere, then relax as you can literally send trains anywhere.

The main attraction/gameplay of this is building tracks at the right places, sending out trains at the right time, and flipping switches accordingly, all while making sure you don't go bankrupt. If you get this game expecting anything else you will be disappointed, but otherwise as a puzzle junkie this is great stuff for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254486135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1599417463}
review:
After watching a YouTube review by TotalBiscuit of this game, I purchased it as he said without the expectation of the realism set down by other games such as Rail Tycoon, etc.  but rather for the "frustrating enjoyment" of playing this style of game.  As a model railroader, I do not hold this game on par but I have so far thoroughly enjoyed it after already putting a number of hours into play.  Parts of the interaction are predictable in many respects, such as the not-so-much random scheduling of trains, that only makes the challenge much more enjoyable to overcome.  I have already completed my levels but I find myself going back to replay in attempts to unlock additional achievements.

I'm new to Steam, and a more mature person in age than probably most here so I have to struggle to keep up with the "younger generation" but I still recommend this game.  I need to learn how to find out about any add-ons or expansion packs for Train Valley so I can keep on playing!

My many thanks and appreciation to the the developers for their hard work and for taking an active part in the player forums!!  I look forward to continuing to be a part of the Train Valley community!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036064023', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1476051823}
review:
So i do not like the game, but the game itself is great, let me explain

if you like Micromanaging and multitasking you might like this little puzzle game, but if you like macromanaging this game i would absolutely not recommend, the only macro aspect in this game is to be able to choose how you want to connect the different stations, that's it, after that its only micro micro and more micro, to quote Direwolf20 "i like my games to play themselves", so definitely good if you like this kind of stressing game with constant pressure, but if you want some train macromanagement, you should play the great OpenTTD wich is free.

also the trailer does not reveal what kind of game really this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021572445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1487102943}
review:
Love the idea, hate the execution.

It has a really weird loose condition: you can't have negative balance, like in all other economy based games, resulting in regular and spontaneous "You are bankrupt" pop ups, while you have 4 really expensive trains on there way to the stations. Usually it happens because you had to expand new rail tracks really long to a new trains station and spend all the money. And than after a minute the tax comes and makes you a bankrupt. So you have to always keep an amount of money on your bank account to not let it happen, though the amount is always growing during the level, so you have to guess or loose.
Can't imagine play testers did not mention it while on development. 

It also has a typical Unity bug: it works really terrible on a dual monitor PC. So you are most likely have to change windows registry to be able to play the game. Also, the devs were not of a particular help here.

The UI even on a regular 1920p monitor is tiny and unintuitive. I have a 27' monitor and it's hard to spot most essential gameplay information when you need to. The tools icons are like 20 pixels at the top of the screen and the new train icon on the station (most essential gameplay ui element in the game) is like 5.

Track building tools are rather unresponsive, far from polished.

The lack of a proper tutorial is a pain also.

It's sad, that developers didn't put enough effort here. The game plays rather nice even with all these problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058656516', 'num_games_owned': 5853, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1478030905}
review:
This game really worth to have a look. I got it in Humble monthly bundle like many others and it was a very good surprise.
Graphics and gameplay are good. It' fun, it has a fine learning curve and I didn't met any bugs.
I bought the DLC to support the developpers and was also very happy with it (a bit short but much more challenging)
Train Valley 2 on tracks?  ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012833532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 756, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1605631358}
review: Not a building strategy as it might seem on a first glance, but logic puzzle directing trains to right stations, switching track, building them so more trains can pass without coliding... it is a simple concept but very catchy, I am surprised noone thought of this before. For a few bucks, it is a great game to play for a few minutes every day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1476996917}
review:
Eigentlich mÃ¼sste Train Valley genau mein Spiel sein. Leider ist das Spiel nicht einmal ansatzweise zu Ende gedacht. 

Im Prinzip baut man seine Routen auf denen die ZÃ¼ge fahren sollen und bestimmt wann die ZÃ¼ge losfahren sollen. Ich hÃ¤tte jetzt ein schÃ¶nes Puzzlespiel erwartet welches idealerweise nett anzuschauen ist (Ã¤hnlich zu Flight Control).

Leider konnte ich auch nach vier Stunden Spielzeit keinen Indikator fÃ¼r die ZuglÃ¤nge entdecken. Manche ZÃ¼ge sind kurz und manche lÃ¤nger. Da es auf den kleinen Karten schnell eng wird kam es bei mir deshalb stÃ¤ndig zu UnfÃ¤llen. UnfÃ¤lle fÃ¼hrten dann eigentlich immer dazu, dass ich einige Ziele nicht erreichen konnte. â†’ Neustart 

Wenn ich es nicht besser wÃ¼sste, fahren manche ZÃ¼ge auch schneller als andere. Hier muss man dann wieder GlÃ¼ck haben. â†’ Neustart

Ich wage es auch zu behaupten, dass manche ZÃ¼ge langsamer oder sogar spÃ¤ter losfahren als andere. Wie man das erkennt konnte ich nicht erkennen. â†’ Neustart

Noch mehr GlÃ¼ck braucht man, wenn man Schienen baut. Nicht nur dass sich der Bau irgendwie merkwÃ¼rdig steuert, fallen auch immer mal wieder Steuern an. Da man nicht sehen kann wie hoch diese sind, war ich des Ã¶fteren Pleite. â†’ Neustart

Das Train Valley ein GlÃ¼cksspiel ist, hÃ¤tte ich ausgehend der Produktbeschreibung nicht gedacht.

2/5

Les gares sont placÃ©es alÃ©atoirement par l'ordinateur et de nouvelles sont posÃ©es pendant la partie, Ã  vous de faire le nÃ©cessaire pour que les trains arrivent Ã  bon port.
Ce n'est certes pas le jeu du siÃ¨cle mais il permet de s'amuser quelques heures...

And I wish there was more content, they should do another DLC. There's a sandbox but that felt kind of pointless and offered no new challenges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172315534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1476836822}
review: A simple, relaxing, casual game. The goal is to build a train track that will transport trains to their designated station colors before you run out of money. More stations pop up over the course of a level, so you must modify your track to adjust while keeping the trains moving and making you money. Not very difficult, enough to be engaging without being frustrating. There is no plot here, just navigating waves of trains until the level is complete. Got this in a humble bundle, and I have to say, it's nice to play a carefree game like this on occasion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976784888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1476289464}
review:
WARNING! PUZZLE GAME!

(Received with the humble monthly bundle)

The train part only consists of closed scripted maps per level and the sandbox mode only shows the same closed level maps... I don't know if you can rotate the map as the trailer shows.

You have to manage yourself the train crossing and beware of trains going out of stations on their own, or else  your tracks will explode everywhere, Michael Bay style.

As other said, il you like fast speed strategy games, this one will be hard enough for you. Take a first look at some let's play before buying it...

Bonus point for colorblind mode!

Oh, and the tutorial is very light : you can pause the game to better think of your strategy!

review: I expected to enjoy this, as I usually enjoy management games, but it just didn't seem to grab me. The UI was a bit clunky and I only got through a level or two before getting bored. Crashed trains a lot, which was fairly entertaining to a certain extent, but overall not hugely impressed. Maybe I could've given it more of a chance, but I don't think this one's for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067040348', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1522121702}
review:
Train Valley was one of the best surprises I've gotten from Humble Monthly so far, I have no idea why I love it as much as I do but I suspect it's a combination of the music and the torturous simple difficulty of the whole affair. You get 3 goals per map, and you can progress to the next one without completing all of them, or at least I suspect you can. Personally, if i fail to complete one of the objectives, or if I cause a collision or go bankrupt, I usually descend into a gibbering cursing madness for a few seconds with cries of "FUCK THIS GAME" or something similar, but then I'm right back at it.

Summarized in Haiku:

Train tracks by a stream
Yellow train collides with red
Fuck you Train Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1476561116}
review:
No, I don't personally like nor recommend [i]Train Valley[/i] but oh boy does my wife play the crap out of it. [b]Moral of the story: this game definately appeals to some folks in a serious way.[/b]

[i]Essentially, this title is a pure puzzle game - the train part is just a skin.[/i] If you are here because you like trains, do yourself a favor and see yourself out now. If you like puzzles in the same vein as [i]Mini Metro[/i], keep reading. You build tracks, and tell trains when to stop and start all while helping them get to their destination. As you play a level (which can be completely seen on one screen), a few new hubs pop up as time goes on. There are three goals per level, which each earn you a stamp in your train book. You manage money, to a certain extent. [b]This game is difficult, so beware.[/b]

[i]Why don't I like it?[/i] Well I find it incredibly tedious to juggle everything in my head, and often, one mistake makes you totally want to start over. Whether it was because you missed out on a stamp/goal, or because it ruined the flow of your play. I also think the track laying mechanic/controls could be substantially better. Yeah, you get used to it after a couple of hours, but c'mon this isn't rocket science.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Although it can be quite difficult, this feels and plays like a zen puzzler; definately charming
+Music is great - BUT man they need to put some dead air in there sometimes - it's on a constant loop and you will start to go nuts after an hour or so
+Easy to learn, very difficult to master

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Out of all the puzzle games I've played, I don't really find this all that addicting, personally
-Music is great - BUT man they need to put some dead air in there sometimes - it's on a constant loop and you will start to go nuts after an hour or so
-No controller support

[b]It's certainly a niche game. If you find yourself intrigued still, I'd go for it.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970880630', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1490036379}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842672', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1476027075}
review:
Train Valley is a fun casual puzzle game. The screenshots and Steam tags may give you the impression that it's a management sim/tycoon game, but this is not really the case.

The core gameplay is fun enough. You build tracks to connect the various stations and then try to get each train to the right destination by manipulating the railroad switches. During each level new stations will keep popping up, forcing you to expand your rail network.

Your main goal in each level is simply to avoid going bankrupt (this is pretty easy for the most part). Additionally, each level has three bonus objectives that provide extra challenges. Some levels also have special trains arriving from outside the map. All in all there's enough variety to keep things interesting for a single playthrough.

My main issue with the game is the fairly high level of randomness. For the most part this is not really a problem as the game is pretty easy anyway, but in the later levels bad luck can really mess you up. This is not really something I enjoy in a puzzle game.

Overall I found Train Valley a pretty enjoyable experience. I'd recommend it to anyone who likes light puzzle games.

The good:
- Fun puzzle gameplay
- Rather relaxing experience

The bad:
- Too many random elements
- Building tracks is somewhat imprecise
- Some of the later levels get rather micromanagement heavy

author: {'steamid': '76561198067937537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1475765335}
review:
While it might not look like it but Train Valley is one of the best puzzle games that I have played in quite a while.

What makes Train Valley stand out is that while it is pretty simplistic it is still challenging. All you do in the game is build tracks and guide the trains towards their destination. The fun comes from creating the routes and juggling multiple trains at the same time while trying to keep them from crashing into one another and running out of money. Train Valley does a great job of being a relaxing game that still challenges you.

I would classify Train Valley as an easy to play but hard to master game. It is not that hard to beat the levels in Train Valley but it becomes quite hard to 100% some of the later levels so there is quite a bit of challenge if you want it. Length wise the game includes 24 levels and should take at least six to eight hours to complete. I found Train Valley enjoyable enought though that I actually wanted to try and complete as many of the additional objectives as I could which can add quite a bit of time to the game. 

If you are looking for a train simulation game or don't really like puzzle games, Train Valley is not going to be for you. If the game's premise sounds interesting though I think you will really enjoy Train Valley. 

If you would like to read my full review check out [url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/train-valley-indie-game-review/] Geeky Hobbies [/url] .

author: {'steamid': '76561198013405601', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1481936645}
review:
Full Review at http://www.blotgaming.com/game-reviews/train-valley-review/

At first glance and after playing tycoon games with vast maps itâ€™s easy to think this game is for the young.  We were challenged within the third level, losing trains and going bankrupt.

The logistical nightmare is just so much fun and youâ€™ll find the stress of managing so much lingering in your chest. 

Train Valley is only $9.99 USD ($13 AUD) this game is easily worth $20 USD in our books.  Itâ€™s a bargain price and youâ€™ll re-visit this over and over.  Amazing effort from the 3 man team.

9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023315190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1557961297}
review:
I haven't played this in over probably 6 months, (except for a quick demo to a friend). I really enjoyed the puzzles the game presents, the music, the art too. Once I've built the system I hope will work for the scenario I enjoy pushing out twice the amount of trains the rails can handle and franticly direct them to their destinations. After a while I notice my stiff back, check the clock, and panic after 3 hours have flown by. Great puzzle game with all the excitement I could want! Or even not want; It has a sandbox mode. 

There also have been numerous updates and more levels added since I purchased.

I highly suggest trying the demo if you aren't sure. It will hook you too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154628252', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1473934974}
review:
Train Valley is a great little game that's easy to pick up and tricky to get right. Developed by Alexey Davydov, Sergey Dvoynikov, and Timofey Shargorodskiy. Some of you might know Davydov from another great game called Scrap Garden. The early levels of Train Valley are extremely simple, the difficulty ramps up quickly and you'll soon find yourself struggling to complete all the objectives. The game is balanced out perfectly, everything fits together very well, and the sound adds a certain ambiance that really makes it shine.

Pros
+ Fun game for when you don't have enough time
+ Easy to understand controls
+ Pretty graphics and scenery
+ Good sound effects

Cons
- It gets hard pretty fast

Read the rest of my review here: http://www.keengamer.com/article/14181_train-valley-review#rating

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1474550029}
review:
Train Valley is a surprisingly good title for not a whole lot of money. You just need to have the right expectations.

This is no ecosim, it's a light puzzler with trains. Your goal is to connect the different train yards, of which more will pop up during any given scenario (always in the same place, but at possibly different times each time you retry the level, i.e. upper right instead of lower left and vice versa). Your only tool are tracks and demolition. This is complicated by the terrain and already present tiles with buildings, etc. on them, which makes construction a lot more expensive if you want/need to go through instead of around. After that it's "simply" a matter of sending out trains to the correct stations by manipulation of the railroad switches and avoiding crashes. Easier said than done sometimes.

Trains will "spawn" after a set amount of time (indicated in the bottom right) and automatically leave the station if all stations have spawned trains already (i.e. you were either sleeping or you spawned extra trains and couldn't get them out in time). This can have dire consequences. The longer a train waits and travels the more of its monetary value it will lose. Since the game deducts a yearly fee (and the year goes by very quickly) you can end up bankrupt thus forfeiting the level completely, which means restarting from the very beginning, since there are no check points nor is manual saving a thing.

Add to that 3 different bonus goals (fixed) for each level (spawn x additional trains, earn x amount of money, don't let a train go to the wrong station, don't press pause, etc.) and the game can become quite hectic, despite the availability of a pause feature. It is still easy to misjudge a train's speed though and send out the next too early, so they crash. The switches get out of hand in later levels, so mistakes are easily made, especially since any train going over a switch that does not have to be changed automatically aligns it as well, which can spell trouble for the following train if you're not on your guard.

Crashes are pretty bad most of the time since they not only mean the train and money is lost forever, but you also have to rebuild the tracks, meaning even more money is lost. You could easily go bankrupt until the next train reaches its destination. However, you can stop a train and even turn it around at almost any given time, but of course this has other negative effects like loss of money and time.

If you like a challenge or want to speed things up, you can do so by up to 4 times the regular speed (2x and 4x speed). Do not press the pause button and see if you can survive ;)

The DLC "Germany" adds a new chapter to Europe, America, Russia and Japan, complete with new trains, new hazards and new music. Every region in the game features its own soundtrack and some levels have interesting hazards to play around with, for example unstoppable speed trains, or even bombing runs. Well worth it in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998534868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1521013829}
review:
This is a great little game that's easy to pick up and tricky to get right. While the early levels are extremely simple, the difficulty ramps up quickly and you'll soon find yourself struggling to complete all the objectives.

There's some great polish here, everything fits together very well, and the sound adds a certain ambiance that really makes it shine.

While some more DLC and larger, more complicated levels for those that want to really test themselves would be great it's already a fun experience and totally worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132708477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1679305483}
review:
Fun, challenging and amazing little game. If your like me and want to get the best score in each level it can get a bit harder and sometimes just really make you almost wanna rage quit :P. But yeah im really enjoying the game love trains and this is a fun game with trains in it :D! Really worth buying, levels are challenging and fun to play, scenery of the levels is beautiful too look at, train designs are pretty cool too, its also cool that they have multiple train designs. The game also has a sandbox mode haven't used it myself but there are probably some people who might find that fun too :)! Im just going to stick to the campaign mode :)!

9/10 Worth buying if u like trains :)!


Edit: Forgot to mention that this game also has different centuries. So for example the first few levels are from the 1800s and the more you progress the further you get with the time. Also the game has different environments so your not sticking to one place for the whole game. They actually take you through alot of continents, for example the first few levels are based in countries in Europe after you complete those levels the next continent will be America and so on, it doesn't STICK with one level design throughout the whole game it actually CHANGES from designs, trains, continents and even countries which makes this a fun little game :)! WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS GAME!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007799385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1468407516}
review:
10/10: Unglaublich fesselnde Spielmechanik!

Super Zugsimulation bzw. Puzzlespiel, dann das ist die eigentliche Spielmechanik und diese ist echt der Gewinner in diesem Spiel. 
Der Einstiegt und die Spielregeln sind superschnell verstanden und erzeugen dabei in den spÃ¤teren Leveln durch hervorragendes Gamedesign eine unglaubliche KomplexitÃ¤t und Tiefe. Diese Sorgt mit den zusÃ¤tzlichen Zielbedingungen sowie den Steam Errungenschaften einen echten wiederspielwert der Levels gibt (habe im durchschnitte mindestens alle Levels zweimal gespielt).
Hier kommt auch das einzige Problem welches ich mit dem Spiel habe: ICH WILL MEHR! :D
Damit meine ich aber nicht den Preis, im VerhÃ¤ltnis zum Inhalt: FÃ¼r 10 Euro (Plus 2,50 Euro fÃ¼r den sich echt lohnenden â€Deutschlandâ€œ-DLC) finde ich einige Stunden wirklich hervorragenden spielspaÃŸ absolut Preisgerecht. Wenn das Spiel dann auch noch Steam im Angebot ist, kann eigentlich jeder der mal auf ein klasse Spiel zwischen seinen AAA-Spielen oder seinem MOBA Lust hat bedenkenlos zuschlagen.
Somit eine Verdiente 10/10! 

PS: Ist ein guter Kandidat fÃ¼r ein â€Perfektes Spielâ€œ (brauchte fÃ¼r alle Errungenschaften etwas Ã¼ber 20 Stunden)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027292225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1470069366}
review:
English than Portuguese

From someone if 27.6 hours played and who finished the game with all the " Stamps" and completed as All the Achievements (with exception of those in dlc )

English:
I believe it is important to tell those interested in buying this game that, although it is a very good game, is not exactly a train simulator.
If you exchange the stations for water records, the tracks for pipes and the trains for water, the game operation would remain exactly the same (!), so, itÂ´s a puzzle that uses the "skin" of trains . In the end, you donÂ´t do nothing but have to come up with a way to take the trains (replaceable by any other object) from point "A" to "B" point.
The criticism is because I bought the game having in mind something like the old Railroad Tycoon II, and there is absolutely nothing of his features here.
There is no management of the trains. You indicates your ways and just take care of the break.
The connection of the tracks is simple, limiting creativity in creating lines (intersections) more complex.
There is no freedom to choose which trains to use, which loads carry loads, which station is more important to get that load, and so on .... it is a puzzle where you connect points. A very good and even challenging at times, but a puzzle. Not a simulator.
Likes puzzles, go ahead.
Expect something more than a puzzle ... better pass or run the risk in a very good sale.

PortuguÃªs:

Para indicar minha experiÃªncia com o jogo, tenho 27.6hr. de jogadas e terminei todas as fases, cumprindo com todos os desafios (sÃ£o trÃªs por fase). Tenho todas as conquistas existentes com exceÃ§Ã£o daquelas constantes na dlc

Acredito que seja importante avisar Ã queles interessados na compra deste jogo que, apesar de se tratar de um game muito bom, nÃ£o Ã© exatamente um simulador de trens.
Se vocÃª trocar as estaÃ§Ãµes por registros de Ã¡gua, os trilhos por canos e e os trens por Ã¡gua, o funcionamento do jogo continuaria sendo exatamente o mesmo (!), ou seja, trata-se de um puzzle que utiliza a "skin" de trens. No final das contas, vc. nÃ£o faz nada alÃ©m de ter de bolar uma maneira de levar os trens (substituÃ­veis por qualquer outro objeto) do ponto "A" ao ponto "B".
A crÃ­tica fica pq. comprei o jogo tendo em mente algo como o antigo Railroad Tycoon II, e nÃ£o existe absolutamente nenhuma caracterÃ­stica deste.
NÃ£o hÃ¡ administraÃ§Ã£o dos trens. VocÃª dita seus caminhos e no mÃ¡ximo os pausa. 
A conexÃ£o dos trilhos Ã© bem simples o que limita a criatividade na criaÃ§Ã£o de linhas mais complexas (cruzamentos mais complexos).
NÃ£o hÃ¡ liberdade para escolher que trens usar, os evoluir/melhorar, que cargas levar, para onde levar, a importÃ¢ncia da carga para aquele local e assim por diante.... se trata de um puzzle de conectar pontos. Um muito bom e atÃ© desafiador Ã s vezes, porÃ©m, um puzzle. NÃ£o um simulador.
Curte Puzzles, vÃ¡ em frente.
Espera algo mais do que um quebra-cabeÃ§a... melhor deixar passar ou correr o risco em uma sale muito boa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010320233', 'num_games_owned': 2700, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1469406888}
review:
I'm writing this review after finishing 100%.

Overall the game is a solid puzzle game with two main components: management of time and management of space. I would recommend this for anyone enjoying puzzle games.

Main positives:
- solid amount of content
- achievements are sensible and are actually a good challenge

Main negatives:
- the randomized nature of the levels can be annoying at times
- can feel very dry and repetitive

author: {'steamid': '76561198083437938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1573506391}
review:
This is a great puzzle game.  It starts easy, but gets difficult as you progress through the levels.  To meet all three objectives for the levels, I replayed some of the maps 5, 10, and even 15 times.  If one track strategy doesn't work, try putting tracks in a different location.

Anyway, an awesome game that I highly recommend if you like puzzle-solving type games.  And it runs great on Linux.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198271451378', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1526165222}
review:
A complex and fun game that is a great way to pass the time and get your mind off the real world for a little while. 
The enjoyment I expierenced through my frustration only made me want to play the game more as I thought initially that I would end up refunding it because it just seemed odd... however this is a well put together game. 
Everyone who says it's addicting is 100% correct and I highly reccomend it.
